description:
You hear about other people stumbling upon a hidden gem of a wonderful restaurant, but my brother and sister in law finally found one on their own. They were raving about this place literally for weeks or months before they took me here for my birthday and admittedly I was skeptical "yeah yeah it sounds great" because usually when someone hypes something up too much whether it's a movie or a dining experience, it's almost always something of a letdown. 

But not The Richmond though, they do not disappoint! I honestly can't think of anything I have been more impressed with in a very long time. Every single item on the menu that I tried was superb and five star caliber. The chef and owner who is very friendly and personable spends a lot of time at each table and makes you feel special; almost as if your table is the only one and your group are the only guests in the restaurant while there are other tables separated by curtains he is also attending to with personal care and attentiveness.  

When my then 7 year old niece Lauren craved Apple Cider, he informed us that unfortunately they did not have apple cider, but get this! he sent one of his employees out to the store to buy a chilled bottle of Martinelli's sparking cider just for her. Now that is wonderful service! 

I rarely go into detail about the actual meal when writing about a restaurant on Yelp but I can vividly remember everything I had even though this was my birthday back on August 10th. First thing they served was warm sliced baguette with three different types of soft butter, one was regular butter, another one was Olive butter and the third was butter with herbs and chives, all three and the warm baguette pieces were delicious. they then brought a bowl of butternut squash soup, so good and so much better than that French onion soup they serve you at a lot of other places. The next thing was a huge scallop over braised sirloin and polenta; everything about that was done to perfection and I really wanted another one after finishing the first. seriously the tastiest scallop I ever had. 

My duck with potatoes and vegetables was the best I ever ate! Even my dad who thinks that only Germans know how to make duck and goose right said his duck was excellent. I ordered the Peach Crisp which was seasonal and replaced the usual apple crisp but they surprised me with an 'on the house' complimentary birthday dessert before my peach crisp with vanilla ice cream even arrived. They brought me a panna- cotta .. (not sure why it's auto correcting "panna cotta" No I did not have Panda cotta! I gave up panda years ago), Seriously though, I never eat things like Veal or Foie gras or even caged eggs, but the food here is so good that I might have tried one of those if someone were offering me a sampling. I did try small potions of what others were having and everything here is delicious!  

If the food wasn't amazing enough, what has everyones mind blown is the more than reasonable price! Compared to a comparable place like Chapeau on Clement street which we have frequented for many many years; and the food here is far superior in my opinion, the bill is somewhere between 25-30% less expensive. Just incredible! For a party of six, (including my niece who had her own adult meal), appetizers, entrees, desserts, bread, several glasses of wine, beer etc was around $300 before gratuity. My friend Bryan who has also tried The Richmond based on the recommendation from my brother said "Wow! that's the first time in my entire life that I have ever been sticker shocked in the opposite way" Just an amazing value.

If I can find anything to complain about, it's very difficult to find a parking space around here and no valet parking service to my knowledge. The waitress took unusually long intervals of time before noticing us when needing something from her and it was difficult to flag her down but if that's the only complaint I can even think of, this restaurant still deserves all five stars and more.
author: David A.

description:
Seriously one of the best meals (and deals) in SF! Chef owner, John, gives each guest personal attention and makes the fabulous food even more special with his warmth and kindness.
The pace is slow...you can relax here and enjoy yourself. It's a small, intimate space cleverly separated by curtains to reduce ambient noise. We had the 3 course tasting menu and were there for about 2.5 hours. When John learned that we like to share from each other's plates, he made a point to split one of the appetizers and one of the desserts for us. Such beautiful, personal service!
My bf had the wine pairing and was blown away by the chef's talent for perfectly matching wine to food.
We will definitely be back! You shouldn't wait to try it if you haven't yet.
author: Teri K.

description:
John Owyang's "The Richmond", on Balboa between 7 and 8 Ave...!!!

...makes putting up with the weather...worth it.
We at there again, last nite. Again...a great experience, to put it mildly!!

$40 for a three course meal, and free appetizers....!

I think we will do it, monthly, to reward ourselves for putting up with the weather, honest to god.
author: John B.

description: Great food and awesome atmosphere in the heart of the Richmond District.    Small restaurant so reservation is recommended.
author: Lawrence L.

description:
Very unassuming but food and service was good and love the intimate atmosphere!  We came here Thursday (12/7/17) for a date night at 8pm.

Venue: very unassuming from the outside and slightly dark.  However, what is rather unique is that most of the seats are surrounded by curtains, providing a very intimate setting, especially if you are on a date.  The curtains are great because not only do they make your table feel more private, but they also absorb some of the sound so you don't hear too much of other tables' conversations.  It can at times feel like it can be a bit crowded in the areas between tables / curtains.  

Service: even with the curtains making you feel like you might be missed by the staff, the service was pretty good.  They came into your little booth often enough to check in and see if you need anything / take plates away.  Was worried you'd be forgotten, but that wasn't the case here!

Food: they offer a three course tasting menu, choosing an appetizer, entree and dessert, all for $37.50 per person; each course offers 3-5 choices.
-- Crab Cake + Summer Squash Salad (squash, pine nuts, piave, watercress & herb vinaigrette) - crab was greatly seasoned, and the outside was nice and crispy.  Lot of chunks of crab so you know its crab and not too heavy!  The squash salad was also a good counterpoint with its lightness and acidity.  

-- Bone-In Pork Chop with Mashed Potatoes (seasonal vegetables) - I don't eat a lot of pork, but decided to give this a try.  The pork chop was seasoned simply, but the deep, rich sauce made up for that.  Pork chop itself was cooked well- not too dry and still moist inside.  String beans were slightly overcooked but otherwise liked this dish.

-- Apple Crisp (roasted apples, streusel & vanilla ice cream) - The streusel added great texture to the softened, slightly acidic apples and smooth ice cream.  The streusel was also not too sweet, so you didn't feel like you will get too much of a cavity.  

My date similarly loved two of his dishes (braised short rib + scallop and braised duck), but we both admit that the panna cotta dessert he ordered was just WAY too sweet.  

All in all, this is a perfect date spot / dinner place if you want a bit of privacy.  Food was overall decent (minus a few bad choices) and service was good.  A bit far out for me to want to go to frequently, but worth a visit at least once.
author: Audrey H.

description: Thank you Chef John!! My buddy and I had such a phenomenal meal. And that space!!?! Private tables surrounded in long drapes to muffle sound!! I was so transported to a place I've never been but want to go back to. Very aspect for spot on, deliberate and at ease. As a server I was in awe with this special style of service. I will be back to see you soon.
author: Dano R.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in SF. My man and I go to a lot of nice restaurants but this is the only one which we became regulars. This quaint, little off-the-beaten path, hidden gem is pure romance and charm. The chef, John, serves you himself and will tailor the wine pairings to your liking, which makes it a very intimate setting. He pours heavy! And at an unbeatable price. The fois gras is heaven and John is not stingy on serving size. 
My fiancé and I got engaged here and it was a beautiful night. We continue to bring friends to the Richmond, all of which love the restaurant and call it a "hidden gem." Can't wait until next time!!
author: Katy T.

description:
It's been couple years haven't come here. This's probably my 5th visit to this restaurant. If I live in SF, I would have come here more often than those Johnathan Gold's recommendation in LA. 

Great wine selection with reasonable price. We brought our wine and corkage fee is $25 per bottle. 

4 adults for my sis's BD, we tried the 3 courses tasting menu. 

Bread with different butter: Olive, sea salt and chive. All butter taste good with warm baguette.

John's compliment: Potato leek soup. 

Appetizer: Braised short rib with scallops, crab cake and crispy pancetta. All taste good. Highly recommended crab cake and short rib.

Entree: New York steak, braised duck and bone-in pork chop. All taste good. Highly recommended the pork chop, it was so tender and juicy.

Dessert: warm chocolate and peanut butter torte, panna cotta, coffee semifreddo and apple crisp. All taste pretty good. Highly recommended coffee semifreddo and apple crisp. 

I think with the service and quality of food. $40 is a steal. We had a great BD celebration last night here. I will come here to try the 5 courses tasting menu next time.
author: Lilian C.

description: I had dinner with a large group last night and the meal was wonderful.  John the owner & chef took great care of us and put together a delicious meal that included his signature crab cake as well as a fantastic salmon and steak.  This restaurant is an absolute gem with great food and a wonderful wine list.  I highly recommend it if you are in San Francisco.
author: Carlos D.

description: It's a gem! Unique in every way!! Quiet romantic ambience! Excellent music selection in the background!  Fantastic tasty food, no matter what you choose! Super attentive and welcoming staff, the best customer service you'll ever get in a restaurant! The Chef/Host makes this dinner experience you won't forget. I've never seen such personal touch to every dish, wine glass and over all dining. Totally worth every penny! Make reservations ahead of time, you will need to book it 3-4 weeks if you want 6pm spot and plan on staying in for a few hours. Will definitely recommend this place!
author: Natalie G.

description:
Yes, decor could be updated a bit, but food was excellent and a very reasonable price. Wine list was extensive and also reasonable. Definitely get the short rib and the semi-freddo. The surprise was the vegetarian terrine that was well executed. Chef John was extremely hospitable and took care of us well. 

Very vegetarian friendly -- I enjoyed the corn brioche pudding.

Really good bang for your buck and reservations aren't impossible for a city where you will be hard to find both.
author: William H.

description: Tried to make a reservation here for my FIL's  80th for a party of 14, basically the entire family. Started correspondence on menu, likely a preorder or limited offering. Midway through after realizing that half the party was below drinking age our party was refused since he wouldn't make any money since the alcohol tab would be too low. Keep in mind that we were clear from the beginning that this was a family celebration. Most 80 year olds don't have 6 drinking age grandchildren. Needless to say we'll never eat here. Hope they unknowingly host an AA graduation party soon.
author: Jess C.

description: The food was five stars. We loved everything we picked from the reasonably-priced, three-course menu. I will definitely go back. The physical space is a little worn and could use a refresh.
author: Morris R.

description:
The food is fantastic and the price is amazing for what you get.  Six of us had reservations for 6:30 midweek and we were the first ones there.  The chef/owner/waiter, John spent time with us telling us about himself and the restaurant.  It was like going to a friend's house for dinner.
We had the three-course meal but we didn't think we could handle three glasses of wine so we ordered a bottle (one had beer).  John was very helpful suggesting an appropriate wine. He did not push for a more expensive bottle.
Everyone raved about their food.  The portions were either just right or a little too big.  The two people who ordered the pork chop took some home.  I had the duck and it was the best I've ever had.  Raves for the steak, also.  Overall a great experience for everyone.
author: William W.

description: happy dinning experience ;) enjoyed the privacy, quietness and relaxing atmosphere. Food are delicious and portions are good!! Definitely worth what you are paying, 5 stars!! like!
author: Jane D.

description:
What a wonderful neighborhood gem. I loved my visit to the richmond. It's delicious food, super healthy portions (I was so stuffed in a good way!), and special intimate atmosphere. 

There's only a few tables here, and they're all separated pretty well with heavy curtains so it feels very private. The chef comes out to take your order, and give tonight's specials. It's a nice personal touch. The menu options are all three courses or five courses. The five courses looked delicious but I'm glad I picked three because again I was so stuffed! 

The only thing that bugged me was that they had lighting up where all the bulbs were out except for one.. perhaps just take it down if only one bulb is working. It didn't really add to the atmosphere. Just a thought.

Overall, I would definitely come again. Also my parents loved it and they don't like anything so that said a lot that it's parents approved.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Surprised to find this restaurant on Balboa and surprised it has been around for 14 years. 
The food was good. The foie gras with French toast was excellent. Never had a foie gras pairing like this and i really liked the confluence of flavors. 

Wine pairing ended up with John pouring two different wines per course as my mom couldn't decide what she liked. 
Excellent service and excellent value (had to leave 25% tip as i felt we got too much value).
author: Roland L.

description:
Excellent neighborhood bistro with very low prices and an interesting wine list. 

This is a little 6 table restaurant  in the Richmond. The chef and owner is also the maitre d, bus boy and waiter. He has very interesting ideas about wine, restaurant pricing, and table presentation (he doesn't like cans on the table and decanted my husband's diet coke).

They have tasting menu format for all diners. We went with the 3 courses. My husband also had the wine pairings while my father ordered wine by the glass. 

I started with the diver scallop and short run. It was excellent. The scallop was fresh and perfectly seared, and the meat was tender. Then I had the duck. I found the sauce as little sweet, but the meat was good. For dessert, I had the chocolate peanut butter torte, whic h was more of a chocolate peanut butter lava cake. It was very rich and filling.

 My husband and father both started with the crabcake, which was huge and full of crabmeat. My husband had the pork chop which was good. My dad had the salmon, which was the best entree. For dessert, my husband had the coffee granita, and he said it was the best restaurant dessert he's ever had. I wouldn't know, as he ate it all!
author: michelle l.

description:
Great prices for the quality and quantity of food. I was looking for a last minute reservation to celebrate Father's Day and was fortunate enough to come across the Richmond in my yelp search. This is a small restaurant that appears to be run by just a couple but they are very catering and attentive.  The chef will take your order and address any questions on the menu with lots of detail and passion. 

We had the 3 course, prix fixe menu ($37/person) which offers a decent selection of options. I recommend ordering the following items:

Starters
Crab Cakes - extremely fresh and decent-sized portion of crab for an appetizer 
Whisky Braised Oxtail w/Maine Diver Scallop 

Entress
Seared Hanger Steak 
Braised Duck Leg 

Dessert
Fresh Cream Panna Cotta
Apricot Cobbler 

An extra plus is they serve bread which comes with 3 unique spreads: lightly salted butter, olive butter and parsley butter. The parsley was by far my favorite and the owners were more than willing to provide more bread/spread if asked. 

If you need a nice dinner to celebrate anniversary, birthday or event, definitely give this place a try. Nice alternative to other pricier restaurants without the crazy wait if you may reservations a week or so in advance as space is limited.
author: Kristy L.

description:
We bought this restaurant out one night for a family get-together! The intimate restaurant was a perfect fit for our 36 person party. The Chef, John, was very accommodating and helped us pre-plan a menu for the night. All the dishes were fantastic but these are the ones you MUST GET:

Crab Cake: 5/5
Crispy exterior and moist meaty interior. It was perfect! 
  
Red Wine Braised Short Rib w/ Maine Diver Scallop: 5/5 [Best Dish]
Scallop was perfectly seared and not overcooked. Short Rib melts in your mouth and explodes with flavor. The creamy polenta was decent but I would rather have creamy mashed potatoes.
author: Kevin K.

description:
We had an amazing experience here for my birthday. Like Cherylynn N. said, ballin on a budget. Food was amazing (SEARED FOIE GRASSSSSS FTW) and the wine pairings were great! John stopped by and delivered the drinks and food himself each time. Though he seemed a little quiet, you can tell he loves food and has a great passion for it. Some of the dishes were a little different, not all were my favorite, but most were delicious. The NY strip steak was melt in your mouth good!!

I took off a stare mainly for decor and the lack of parking. It took us a while to find parking :( and the decor is a bit dated. However, i'd rather have dated decor and delicious food and wine than the other way around!!!

We will be back, Chef John!! =]
author: Judy W.

description: I am a globe trotter and foodie. Michelin star restaurants are my forte . The seared steak I had here last Thursday is beyond compare.
author: Deb G.

description:
We were walking around the neighborhood and noticed this attractive little restaurant. We were taking a look at the menu when the owner took notice and waved & smiled. Little did he know, we already had reservations for later that evening. When we returned, we were once again greeted with a warm welcome. As we entered through the front door, there was a small bar that seats about 4 or so people. We were then led past a set of red velvet curtains into the dining area, where an accent wall was decorated with wood panels from wine crates. Very nice touch.  

Our server, who I presume is the owner, first brought out an amuse bouche of puff pastry w/ ham & cheese. It was simple, simply tasty. The golden brown layers puffed up nicely and formed into 2 miniature cheese sandwiches.

The wine list was surprisingly lengthy for a small family-run restaurant. Most of the glasses were under $10, so you can actually enjoy a drink or two, while staying within budget. The owner discussed several of his favorite wines, so I told him to go ahead and surprise me, to which he replied, "I have something you will love." No more than a couple minutes passed when he returned and apologized for keeping us waiting. I was confused ... what wait? Of course we said "No worries." To make up for the 'wait,' he said he would take the wine off of our bill. That was totally unnecessary and very generous of him, but hey, I'm not one to argue!

Next we received a fresh loaf of warm bread w/ parsley & chive butter, salted butter, & olive butter. Everything was delightful and we hadn't spent a dime yet.

$10.95 Crab Cake w/ spinach salad:
This crab cake was warm and moist inside with a crunchy, thin exterior. Most crab cakes don't do it for me, because I don't love shredded crab, but this one was pretty good. I could have eaten another one. Maybe it was because it was served hot and fresh. The spinach salad on the side consisted of simply a few spinach leaves with a creamy dressing. 

$10.95 Whisky Braised Oxtail & Maine Diver Scallop on creamy polenta:
The oxtail was delicious and juicy. The thick scallop sat on top like a medallion with a nice char on the outside. The polenta was indeed creamy and did not have any gritty texture, partially because it was sitting in the braising liquid. I could have had two orders of this and it would have been an excellent meal.

$20.95 Braised Duck Leg in Port Wine Sauce w/ mashed potatoes & vegetables:
The juicy and savory duck meat nearly came off the bone. The mashed potatoes, zucchini and carrots were nice accompaniments and went well with the braising liquid, too.

Mr. Joy ordered a steak, medium-rare, which was served over a bed of arugula. It was also very nice and juicy. The steak juices balanced out the bitter greens very well. 

$6 Coffee Semifreddo w/ coffee ice cream, coffee granite, almond brittle:
Another simple, but very good dish. I always enjoy coffee ice cream. The coffee granite helped to lighten up the richness. The almond brittle was crushed over the top, which made it very easy to eat.

Overall, the food was just delicious without being pretentious, like you'd expect grandma's home-cooking to taste. That is, if your grandma cooks traditional meat & potato dishes with somewhat of a European flair. Combine that with the home-y ambience, and it really does feel like your favorite neighbors invited you over for a nice dinner. The Richmond emulates the idea of a 'neighborhood gem,' because it's not easy finding braised duck leg or hanger steak in the Richmond district that is done so well, and it's nearly impossible to find upscale dishes at such affordable prices these days. Most of all, the service was just so nice that it left us in good spirits.
author: Joy W.

description:
One of the best restaurants I have been to. 

The thing that really stood out to me was the service. The chef / owner / waiter was extremely busy but was relaxed, polite, and happy. He actually takes time to chat with you and make sure you are comfortable. I didn't ask many questions about the food but I'm sure he's very knowledgeable about the ingredients and sources. 

The pre-appetizer was a delcious potato soup that came with warm bread (surprisingly hard to find nowadays) and 3 types of really interesting but good butter. He also gave us a splash of wine to taste. 

The actual meal was amazing as well. Great presentation, huge portions, and flavors meshed well together. The menu isn't huge but you have more than enough choices. We got the salmon/shrimp and duck for entrees and they were perfectly done. It did take a little longer for the food to come out but that's not a problem if you like chatting with whoever you came with. The chef was apologetic and polite throughout too. 

The price is quite fair (I feel like he almost loses money) and is only $37 for a large 3 course meal. The decor is fancy with dark red curtains and noise level is low so you will be comfortable sitting there for hours. 

I wanted to address the 1 star review a little below. Every single dish came out at the perfect temperature. I HIGHLY doubt that food would be served "ice cold and hard as an ice cube". Also I wouldn't trust the opinion of anyone who spells steak as "stake".
author: Jeff W.

description: Phenomenal dining experience!!! Please do not overlook this amazing restaurant, and do call early for reservations
author: Kk S.

description: Don't be fooled by the $$$.  This place won't break the bank, when compared to other three course dinner places ($37/person).  The ambience is nice and quite, but nothing too fancy that you would feel the need to get super dressed up for.  The chef and owner (I assume) came out to talk to us.  The bread starter was delicious and came with three types of butter.  I recommend the crab cakes or oxtail with scallop for a starter.  The steak was cooked well enough for my unrefined palete.  You really can't go wrong with anything for dessert, but I had the coffee semifreddo which was delicious.  Come here for a nice meal with the family without having to shell out tons of dough!
author: Richard L.

description:
Price: 
$146.80 for 5 course tasting menu for two people. This is with tax added on. I don't remember the per person cost pre-tax, but I'm assuming in the low $60ish range. They do have a menu posted online with prices, but it's a little out of date. Either way, it's still a good price for a 5 course tasting menu, especially given the portion size. I've had tasting menus where the portion size was miniscule, like a sliver of meat the size of my thumb tiny, and that is definitely not what you're going to get here. Each dish could pass as a full size meal at another restaurant. On top of that we were given not just one, but two amuse bouches, making this a 7 course meal.  If you're looking for good value, then The Richmond should be on your list of stops. They also have a three course prix fixe and a la carte options if you don't want to go all out on the 5 course. 

Decor:
I rarely give much thought to decor, but this restaurant had an interesting set up. Each table was surrounded by curtains, which essentially turned each table into its own semi-private dining room. It's pretty effective at making a meal feel more intimate. One of the other striking things about the set up is the space between tables. I've dined at my fair share of San Francisco restaurants that have packed as many customers in as possible. I've grown accustomed to the idea that bumping elbows with the table to me is a normal part of SF dining. I was pleasantly surprised by how much space there was here between tables. 

Food: 
Food here was excellent. I knew we were off to a good start when we were brought bread with three types of butter. Our amuse bouches consisted of a salad and a soup. The 5 course tasting menu included a roasted beets salad topped with goat cheese wrapped in phyllo dough, foie gras on brioche, a salmon dish, shortrib and scallops, and a coffee semifreddo. Everything was well executed and delicious. 

I rarely repeat restaurants. There are just too many good options in San Francisco to explore, but I would be willing to give The Richmond a second go. Good food, excellent value, great service, and a roomy yet intimate layout, what's not to love?
author: Tiffany N.

description:
This small unassuming restaurant is my favorite place to eat in all of San Francisco. While many restaurants charge extreme prices for a PrixFixe style menu - this establishment keeps it affordable (by San Francisco standards) - and the quality is always top shelf. 

The biggest difference is the owner/chef John Ha. Every time I am at his restaurant - he reveals another magical idea. Recently - he even came and sat with us to discuss the methods around one of his dishes. He is humble, modest and very personable. He really cares about food - and your experience with it.

Another difference is Ha's obvious investment effort in fostering relationships with local farmers, ranchers and vineyards. He knows and can explain where all his food comes from - and how it was sourced. That kind of open eyed investment in the food community - and the zest with which he shares it as part of the dining experience is very attractive.

I cannot recommend this restaurant enough.
author: Robert M.

description:
It's just one of those special places....
The kindest, most thoughtful service you can imagine.  John and Rudy are absolutely amazing. Have a dinner with wine paring.  You'll thank me.  I promise you.
author: Victor B.

description: I had to leave a review after here tonight. This is a one of a kind of place in San Francisco. The owner is also the chef and as far as I can tell the only winner. Which create an element of charm, but in the and of itself is not necessarily a good thing... But in this case it was awesome.
author: Stuart L.

description:
Our family came with a large party and big expectations for a graduation celebration for my brother. Chef John created a customized tasting menu and delivered excellent flavors, well executed dishes and great wine pairing expertise. One of my favorite parts about coming to the Richmond was the peaceful atmosphere where our family could talk to one another over dinner as we would in our own dining room. 

Thanks again for hosting us and we will surely be back for more! 

Cheers.
author: Tyler P.

description: We chose The Richmond for a small wedding celebration.  Chef John gave us such personal attention, it really made the night special beyond expectations!   Everything was delicious and the wine was excellent!  My family is extremely grateful and will treasure this memorable evening for a lifetime!
author: Kelly D.

description:
My friends and I visited The Richmond for a birthday celebration, and it certainly delivered! We all very much enjoyed the three course dinner, and everything (literally EVERYTHING) we had was absolutely delicious.

The highlights for our group included the crab cake, the scallop and short rib, the roast pork (this dish was my favorite of the night, and in my opinion blows NOPA's pork chop out of the water), and the peach crisp and chocolate/peanut butter torte desserts.

My girlfriend proclaimed The Richmond her favorite restaurant in the city, and we will definitely be returning soon.
author: Justin H.

description:
What makes a five star yelp review?

To some it would be the ambiance, or the hottest and newest chef. Maybe it would be amazing food or location. Perhaps some other esoteric ego stroking event....maybe they have an algorithm for that? 

For me it has to be a combination of quality of food, service, ambiance, and of course wine list.

The Richmond has been a steadfast bastion in the culinary darkness that is Balboa Street (Lord I haven't eaten here since my pre-yelp days). I believe one yelper called it the street where restaurants go to die.

The Richmond is an unassuming looking restaurant from the outside: One could easily drive by without even giving it a notice. However, where can you find a three course meal for $36 dollars ( okay try and get a table at Trestle...pshaah). Let me clarify that: Where can you get a three course meal for 36 dollars, that is mostly locally sourced, served by the warm and friendly owner, that is generously portioned, delicious, in a warm cozy environment??? In San Francisco not many....many places have entrees in the 30 dollar range.

Price is one thing...but the food is really good:

My Crab Cake with Spinach Salad was a lovely large crab cake with mostly crab...light on the breading. Light and crispy with a wonderful crab flavor...the spinach with bacon salad complimented the softer texture of the crab.

My entree Bone-in Pork Roast with a Honey-Mustard Glaze with mashed potatoes & seasonal vegetables was insanely good ( A very generous pork chop). The meat was tender, succulent, and really flavorful. I assume leaving the bone in adds to this tenderness. The mashed potatoes were lightly whipped...not heavy on butter nor cream...and dam tasty. All of the veggies were Al dente.....and a pleasure to eat as well as a compliment to the chop.

Perhaps the least impressive part of the meal was my dessert: A Warm Chocolate & Peanut Butter Torte ...more a chocolate lava cake than Torte. The dessert tasted very pre-made and just lacked that je ne sais quoi. It was okay but lacked flavor and texture.

I must also add that both of my dinning partners are pain in the ass eaters....and they loved every single course that they partook of.

Throw in a wine list with a great range of nice wines....from 30 dollar bottles to 500 buck cult wines.....John will help you choose as he is very proud of the collection.

So back to my original question: what makes a 5 Star Yelp restaurant? A place like the Richmond restaurant that serves you an amazing meal, served with heart and soul, in a warm and comfortable environment, at a very very reasonable price!
author: David G.

description: Just finished dinner at the Richmond. It is indeed one of the best resturant we been to in many years. Thomas our server was excellent, the owner was nice and friendly. We want to thank them both. We will definitely come back again.
author: Victor Y.

description:
I really appreciated that this place attends to each guest without rush, is mellow, and offers a complimentary dish and bread with good spreads. The beet salad is a bit too oily, and the scallop appetizer is on the heavy side, but I can't say I'm terribly disappointed. 

The head chef tries extremely hard to offer attentive service. It's to the point that I felt he needed reassurance that he was doing a good job, which was weird. However, I'd rather be served that way than ignored. 

My bff thought her salmon was great (and other dishes, too) and loved the vibe, and that made my night more than anything...
author: Paulina F.

description:
This place is so good. The chef really knows his stuff. Everything was decided by him. You gotta get a reservation. But on occasion you might get lucky and get seated on a simple phone call. 

It's a 3-5 course dinner. You can choose off a menu but I think it's best to let the chef decide. 

He's super knowledgeable about wine. He explains it's history and how each glass fits the course you're eating. Excellent service and food. Definitely will come back.
author: Jesse J.

description:
5 Star Food and Service!
I have been coming to The Richmond for several years now and have even held my company's holiday party here a few times. John and his wife are amazing hosts, the food is gourmet 5 star, this is the best kept secret in San Francisco. My husband is Vegan, my friends vegetarian, John is always able to cook something to that meets our needs. The tasting menu and wine pairing are the way to go, I am not kidding when I say this is some of the best food I have eaten in the Bay Area. Not only is John an amazing chef, he knows how to pair wine with food and is tableside to give you the flavors and nuances of the wine they serve. If you are looking for a quiet, cozy restaurant with great service, fair prices and delectable food- The Richmond is the place to be. Book in advance, they are booked solid almost every night of the week!! Thank you John for your fabulous food!
author: Lisa L.

description:
This place was incredible. Food 5 stars. Service 5 stars. We even had our own private dining section. The owner also waited us personally and gave us free wine tasting! 

We didn't pay for a VIP experience at all! Just made a reservation. But WOW did we get VIP..... 

If you go anywhere in SF. Go here.
author: Kate R.

description:
This place has always eluded me until yesterday where my gf and I celebrated our one year anniversary. 

This place is very quiet and intimate. It is small, yet very cozy. Layout of the restaurant is quite interesting as well with the table and seating sectioned off via curtains giving each table a private booth like experience. 

The best part however was our general experience with both the service and the food. When I placed my reservation I had explained that I had food allergies (seafood/shellfish), but still wanted to proceed with the 5 course tasting menu, which did include salmon and scallops. Upon arrival, John Ha, the head chef/owner greeted us at our table personally and explained to me that he have made a custom modification to my part of the menu to accommodate me and my needs. He was very pleasant to talk to and was extremely respectful. In fact, throughout the night we saw him entering and exiting the kitchen greeting all of his other guests in the same manner we were received. 

The food? Very contemporary and very very delicious. There was a balance to every dish and everything was simply perfect. In fact, we were presented with more than the 5 course meal we had expected. The chef had given us some complimentaries with our meals including the Beets and carrots salad and the butternut squash soup. Talk about going above and beyond and exceeding our expectations. Tony and his niece who was the waitress, was very attentive and did their best to provide us the best possible experience. I am definitely going to make every effort to come back again with my other friends and/or special occasions. 

The pictures I will provide will speak for itself.
author: Killah K.

description:
First of all be aware that is a Prix Fix.
We were the very first people there (5:30pm reservation) and we order right away. 
We wait more that 40' for bread and butter. One hour for appetizers. (all salads or no cooked appetizers)
I order a bottle of sparkling water with a lime. No lime "I will send someone to get one" (?). Thirty minutes later I had to remind them about my water, the lime never came.
Appetizers were good. 
Main courses...the pork chop was cold and like a rock, the mushed potatoes COLD, the veggies right out of the refrigerator, cold and raw.
The stake was COLD and red as my blood. 
Desert...they were out of the Apple Crisp so they offer Peach Crisp (with vanila ice cream). The plate itself was really hot, I still wonder why, because the peaches were cold as an ice cube, hard as an ice cube and good luck eating that with a tiny tea spoon.
The waitress wasn't any better.
Not going back. EVER.
author: Masama S.

description: Came here on my birthday last week.  We ordered the pork, duck, crab ball, and desserts.  I called 2 days ahead for a reservation but they said it was all filled.  I tried calling again on my birthday to see if they had room and they did!  When we arrived, there was only another family sitting across from us, so it was pretty dead inside.  I'm guessing everyone canceled on their reservations.  The pork and crab ball was decent, not the best dishes in the world, it was ok.  Their duck was so bland I had to ask for extra salt on the side so and seasoned it myself.  Their desserts were bland also and wasnt sweet enough.  Overall, I wouldn't come back unless someone paid for me.
author: Randy P.

description:
The good: The ambience is calm and quiet, and the service is good.
The bad: The menu, it is plain - steak, duck, chicken and pork. Starters are basic as well.
The ugly: The food, especially the steak, it was salty! Felt excessive gas afterwards implying that the meat may have been old. So was the short rib starter, just average.
Can't give it more than 2 stars.
author: Ethan H.

description:
All right. The food is quite good. 

The seared scallop atop braised short rib and creamy polenta? Marvelous.
The harvest salad? Everything I want in a salad (read: meat, cheese, candied nuts).
The sweetbreads? The reason everyone should stop being scared of sweetbreads.
And the rest of it? The duck, the corn pudding, the soup, the pork...all very good.

Seriously, don't worry about any of that. You're going to have a good meal. (Also, it will be one that starts with a delightful amuse bouche, and excellent bread with three choices of butter.)

I want to talk about how IN ADDITION to serving excellent food at what are VERY reasonable prices for SF, this restaurant also happens to be run by the nicest people ever. They are almost weirdly nice. Three examples:

1. My father's steak was overcooked. But rather than serve it, the chef came out and apologized for the error, and let us know that he'd be re-firing it, and that's why our mains were taking a bit longer than they should.

2. The waitress was SO HAPPY to see my grandmother. Not because they know each other, but because I guess she looks like the waitress's grandmother. It meant she came over and chatted with us constantly (but in a friendly, non-intrusive way in case this worries you) and gladly took 78 group photos of us in the lovely semi-private room they have.

3. When our car was broken into during the meal,* the staff came outside and helped my parents clean the broken glass out of the backseat.** Not only that, but they gave us cardboard and their own tablecloths to put down over the seat just in case.

Basically, The Richmond is doing it right. 
_____________

*Yeah, that happened. Damn kids these days. 
**I know, my brother and I should've been the ones doing that...but we were already on the way to a bar before we knew that happened. I know, we're terrible sons.
author: Peter D.

description:
The Richmond is totally a neighborhood gem and a wonderful family ran business!  I've had this restaurant bookmarked for about a year.  You can totally miss The Richmond when you drive by Balboa as it's around a laundromat and residences.  I made reservations well enough in advance for the Richmond via phone for our Valentine's Day dinner at 6pm.  This is a family run business, with the chef/owner coming out to take your order and his niece helping out as hostess/waitress.  

We were the second couple to arrive, but within our stay they started to fill it up but pacing appropriately.  The restaurant is also a little bigger than it seems on the outside.  I love the curtains and wine displays; it's quite charming.  They had a lot of pre frix menu options, and let you customize it as well upon asking.  So, we both did the three course and for $10 more he added on the foie gras for his appetizer.  For his main he had the beef and the coffee semifreddo for dessert.  For my dinner I went with the braised shortrib with seared scallop, duck leg and the apple crisp.  He had a red and I also had a glass of Riesling.  

Everything was paced very well and for our amuse bouche a ham and cheese puff pastry was served.  It was nice and flaky and the perfect thing to get our appetite going.  The bread was fresh and crusty.  Loved the butters it was served with - traditional with sea salt, olive, and chive.  The foie gras was magical!  He said it was probably his favorite foie gras dish that he's had.  It was seared and served on pain perdu with diced apples.  The sweet, savory, salty combinations were amazing!  The shortrib and scallop appetizer was a huge portion of tender beef and that scallop melted like butter.  The duck leg easily came off the bone and was served in a delicious wine sauce with buttery mashed potatoes and fresh veggies.  He loved his hunk of beef as well.

We forced ourselves to finish our entrees and lastly dessert came around.  The apple crisp was not overly sweet, as the tart flavors from the apple married well with the sweet crisp and cold vanilla ice cream.  His semi freddo had great texture from the coffee granite.  I also tasted some alcohol in it as well.  

The Richmond is a wonderful restaurant serving food you would expect at a fine dining establishment at more affordable prices.  Our whole meal pre-tip was around $100.  We can't wait to come back to try their other dishes..and for more foie gras.  Get there early to try to find parking in this hard area!  It took us about 10 minutes of circling around and getting lucky.  I would give it a 4.5 rounded up.
author: Cat C.

description:
We had a sampling of almost every dish on the menu since there were like 5 of us, and every single thing was delicious! We tried:

1. French bread with three different flavored butters
2. Harvest salad with pear vinigrette
3. Crab cake
4. Shrimp fritter
5. Sweetbreads and foie grois
6. Shortrib and scallop
7. Duck
8. Desserts: apple crisp, chocolate and peanut butter cake, coffee semifredo, and panna cotta

My favorite was the shortrib. But seriously, everything was tasty. The chef comes out personally to present each course and to explain each wine pairing. 

Excellent meal!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
OH MY GOODNESS. This place is divine....I'm still dreaming about it weeks later. I'd walked by it hundreds of times and always thought, "That place looks fancy, better find a special occasion so I can go there!" And I did! 

Service:
My boyfriend and I stopped by (without a reservation) on a Thursday evening. We were met with a bit of apprehension since the wait staff is only the owner and his wife, but they let us sit and I can tell you it was maybe the best service I've received in the city in terms of timing and personal touch, and I've dined at some pretty amazing places (Boulevard, Perbacco, Absinthe, Kokkari, North Beach Restaurant, RN74, Chapeau and more) thanks to a job in advertising. That should speak volumes for how attentive this husband and wife duo were, especially knowing they were pretty full that night. I feel the need to applaud the service even more because as a young couple my boyfriend and I have certainly experienced age-ism from wait staff at other establishments--that was not the case here at all and has certainly put The Richmond on our list of Romantic Meals in the city.

Food:
We were treated to a delicious soup and bread spread with three tasting sauces on the house, very generous wine pours, and DELICIOUS entrees. Honestly, every bite and sip was exquisite. We ordered the prix fixe three-course menu. I had the beet salad, duck, and apple crisp, and my honey had the beet salad, pork roast, and chocolate peanut butter cake. The duck was divine--the meat fell off the bone, perfectly moist. 

Atmosphere:
Oh my goodness the atmosphere in this place is SO intimate and romantic. Each table is sectioned off with floor to ceiling velvet fabric, and the walls are covered in best-in-class wooden wine boxes, and a couple large multi-media landscape paintings (think: real branches that protrude from the canvas). It was quiet so you can hear your date and have a lovely conversation, with light music in the background and those velvet curtains to keep out outside conversation. They do have tables that seat about 6-8 as well if you are thinking of having a low-key  celebration with friends. It's 100% indoor seating, which is fine since the neighborhood is usually chilly.

Price:
At ~$35 for an exquisite three-course meal (excluding wine), this is a GREAT value. Wine selection is impressive as well. 

If you are looking for an intimate experience, delicious cuisine, fantastic value, and supporting local business, this is the place for you.
author: Ashley P.

description: What an amazing hidden gem. I came here for my birthday and everything was delicious from the bread and the 3 butters and the generous dishes in the reasonably priced pre fixed menu. The Chef was super friendly and came to chat with us even telling us how to make his delicious potato leek soup! I had Brie appetizer wrapped in phyllo(?), bone in pork chop (perfectly cooked) and the refreshing lemon panna cotta. The kitchen sent out the chocolate peanut butter torte for my birthday and it was really good too! My friends and I are dreaming about our next visit to The Richmond already!
author: Al T.

description:
My boyfriend brought me here for a surprise dinner, and I loved it!

The service was amazing and the chef-owner was so friendly. They have a well thought out menu and an extensive wine list. We both got the 3 course prix fixe. The ingredients were all so fresh and portion sizes were HUGE. I loved the beef short ribs and scallops. Dessert was also good, but we were both stuffed by then.

4.5 stars!
author: Vivian H.

description:
A small, intimate tasting menu restaurant with outstanding food and wine pairing. Wife and I made a reservation here for 5:30 PM on a Saturday but phoned to change it to 6 PM.  I received a call back from the owner asking if we could come earlier than 6 PM as he would be very busy cooking and serving single handedly six tables at 6 PM.  Curious, we did make it by 5:30 PM when it was just opening. We were the first customers and indeed, there were only six tables which were partially partitioned with curtains providing extra intimacy.  We were greeted by a lady who seems to be the owner's wife and were seated promptly.  The Richmond has two sets of tasting menus - a three course dinner with choice of appetizer, entree, and dessert ($40, wine pairing $35), and a fixed five course ($75, wine pairing $45).  Everyone at the same table must have either the three or five course menu. We opted for the five course because it had seared foie gras, my favorite.  We also had wine pairing. The owner came with complimentary pinot grigio which was crisp and dry and very satisfying and an amuse de bouche potato and leek soup which was delicate and delicious.  These were followed by two more appetizers and entrees which were outstandingly delicious with wonderful sauces and blends of flavors.  Particularly memorable were the shrimp fritters, seared foie gras, and oxtail/mushroom ravioli.  The dessert, coffee semifreddo was inventive and satisfying both as dessert and coffee.  Wife thought the owner/chef must have been trained in France but learned that he was "self-taught" and had never been in France.  Perhaps France should invite him to teach!  What makes the restaurant even more outstanding is that even when all the six tables were filled as they did toward the end of our meal, there was very little noise and the gentle background music (mostly oldies- e.g. Nat King Cole) was conducive to a satisfying dinner, as was the friendly and solicitous server couple.  It should also be noted that for the quality and esthetic presentation of each course, the price is more than reasonable, and the wine pairing is certainly a bargain!  This will be one of our favorite restaurants for a quiet, satisfying dinner.


Attachments area
author: Hoyle L.

description:
Dear John,

Thanks for your kind voice mail to ask me "not to book at your restaurant any more" after my phone died spending hours at Apple store & another 2 1/2 hrs after hours with their tech support and subsequently missed my reservation & received your message after the fact.  

No, I did not intentionally missed it nor did I have a family emergency, I had no access to my phone/calendar that week but you're the only one coming back to me with a rude message.  

I had been looking forward to dine at The Richmond and finally came around to it and life happened so to that, I apologize but your message is simply unprofessional & unforgiving.

Thanks again for reminding me I should not book at your restaurant any more.  I wish you well in filling your seats as you indicated there're only 7 tables so you should have no trouble with your incredible customer service.  

I rarely leave negative reviews as there's plenty negativity in the world, but I hope you know your message did not help the matter and was not received well from someone who's been in the industry.

Happy Holidays...
author: Stephanie C.

description: Yum yum yum. Best bang for your buck is the awesome burger that comes with fries. Love the bread with 3 flavored butters. Ambiance is romantic and perfect for small gatherings. Max it at 4 people. Great variety of vines and options by the glass. I live nearby so when I am looking for a nice dinner option I would recommend coming to the bar for some vino and good food. Reservations recommended.
author: Linda L.

description:
This is a hidden gem in the Richmond neighborhood. It is a charming, intimate, family-owned restaurant that's perfectly suited for special occasions. Thick curtains isolate tables so you feel like you are dining privately. The service is unparalleled in the city; the personalized, genuine service really makes the dining experience unique. 

The menu offers well-prepared starters and entrees. The food is outstanding; you can tell the chefs take great care in selecting the best quality ingredients.

The cherry on top: it is very reasonably priced. You cannot get this level of personalized service and high quality food at a white table cloth restaurant anywhere in the Bay Area at this price. I highly recommend The Richmond.
author: Caroline L.

description: Impeccable food, expertly prepared and served by Chef and owner, John and family. Warmth, generosity and brilliance shine through as does Johns love of his craft- the perfect blend of art and chemistry by folks that care about customer experience and truly enjoy sharing their talent with their dinner guests each evening. Wonderful menu and wine list. Bravo!
author: Gregg C.

description:
Never disappointed coming here. I haven't been back in a few years and I don't know why we stayed away so long!  Food is awesome, fresh and generous portions.
Service. Wine....all good. Excellent!  Great neighborhood local spot. You gotta go.
author: CR L.

description: Awesome food experience on all levels. The food and humble hospitality sets this place from the rest. The knowledge of where their ingredients come from is amazing.  And the wine pairing is also on point, down to the region the grapes are from and how it's processed.
author: gordon g.

description:
I really wanted to like this spot as I love supporting small local businesses unfortunately that was not the case here. 

The best way I can describe this restaurant experience is that the Richmond is run by someone who can cook however has no business in the front of the house.  They went to a few nicer restaurants and tried to imitate what fine dining service should be without the resources or understanding of how to execute. 

The decor is really run down and needed a refresh light bulbs were burnt out all over and curtains were stained and didn't provide privacy as intended. 

The food was probably the best part of the evening, everything came out tasting fine if not at the same time. Overall if you are looking for a decent meal on a budget and don't care about decor / service you might be happy here.

My most significant issue was the service.  I had to ask several times during dinner if we were getting the next course while the "Chef / Waiter / Owner" ran around and tried to correct issues. When addressed he countered with  a significant attitude. Additionally, there was no decorum as he ran around the dining room with three bottles of wine and water pitcher clutched in his arm pit. (Yuck).

This is a location that could benefit from restaurant rescue as the location is good and the food is not terrible.
author: chandler s.

description: I have been here one time, but my mom comes here a few times per year and she always raves about the food. I liked everything from the bread and butter to the dessert. She enjoys the atmosphere along with the food and wine. We both hope this restaurant sticks around. Service is excellent. Any question you ask will be returned with a thoughtful answer. I liked seeing people trust the owner and say: "Please select for us. We don't eat seafood, but we no dietary restrictions."
author: Ato Z.

description:
Great Service!! Wonderful and delicious food --  great appetizers, tasty and mouth watering entrees and amazing desserts!
Also very nice selection of wines. Great atmosphere -- we loved the place and are looking forward to going back.
Great restaurant.
author: John G.

description: Always delicious & a true neighborhood gem. I first brought my father here in early 2016 as a stumble-upon option with a notably quiet ambience. He's not a fan of yelling over a meal, no matter how delicious. John was able to accommodate us night-of with no fuss about lack of notice. Since that initial, exquisite experience with my dad, I've been meaning to take my foodie husband to The Richmond. This year for his birthday he mentioned the venue as an option to book in advance; his birthday fell on a Friday, which arguably can be more competitive than other weeknights. We booked it and the birthday boy agrees: this is not only a very special, delicious restaurant, it's also an intimate experience. Chef-owner John not only prepares the menu, he confirms reservations, takes tables' orders, makes spot-on wine recommendations - who knows, he might even cook & plate every last dish that gets served. It's amazing!! Everyone should know about & experience The Richmond at least once in their lives. I know I look forward to my third & Nth visits!!
author: Vanessa R.

description:
Celebratory 6 months anniversary with boyfriend at The Richmond and they specially reserved a private curtain dining corner area for us! We appreciate the intimate seclusion, John, who is the head chef and owner of The Richmond!

We opted for the 3 dishes from the tasting menu with wine pairings and it was splendid!  They are surely generous with their wine pours and the taste of each one of them, surely enhances the palate.

Starting out with their Amuse Bouche of the day, which consisted of chopped fruits, was a sweet and refreshing opening cleanse.  Then, olive butter and chives with parsley butter as well as regular butter, was served with their loaf of toasty and soft on the inside bread.  The chives with parsley butter, was quite captivating to continue eating on.

I loved their savory appetizer with the perfectly grilled and browned scallop, creamy polenta and tender short rib!  (Must order!)  Their bacon bits, avocado meshed crab cake with spinach salad thousand island dressing that we chose as an appetizer, was all creamy rich. 

The entrees time!  Boyfriend ordered the duck leg braised in port wine sauce (as if wine pairing isn't enough wine already) and I ordered the Top Sirloin Roti.  The braised duck in wine sauce, complimented well with the mixed vegetables, but I liked my Sirloin wrapped around Italian sausage better! 

By the time the desserts arrived, we had plenty of wine glasses still remaining on the table - they surely do generous pours!  Their Pain Perdu and fresh berries reminded me of a strawberry shortcake, but the cake was substituted in a form of buttery toasted warm bread.  I preferred their Chocolate and Peanut Butter Torte with Vanilla Ice Cream.  It was my ideal favorite of warm fudge chocolate with ice cream!  The wine pairings with the dessert, surely left a sweet finishing touch to the palate.

I was stuffed with what seems like endless pours of wine, rich dishes, fabulous and homely servicing and warm congratulations.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
The Richmond is an amazing place for fine dining. The service is excellent, knowledgeable, and very friendly. 

The ambiance is romantic/intimate/and quiet, and feels very private. 

I had an appetizer, main, dessert, and wine, and every single item was exceptional. The roasted pear salad was tossed in the perfect amount of dressing. The pork loin was savory and had a flavorful, semi-sweet sauce. The plating was beautiful as well. 

I would recommend this place to go for a special occasion, or any night that you're looking for a quiet night at an incredible restaurant.
author: Leeyen R.

description: This was one of the better restaurants I've been to in the city. The price was reasonable. The food was great. But the service was by far the best I have experienced in the city. I don't write a lot of reviews, but I was so impressed by this place I had to. Everyone was so nice and accommodating. Very highly recommended!!!
author: Gurpreet R.

description: Wonderful, intimate setting, delicious, reasonable 3 or 5 course Prix fix meals and wine pairings. John and Thu are gracious hosts. Our new fave. But do allow extra time or consider Uber or Lyft, parking is a challenge.
author: Randi S.

description:
We were looking for a good burger and found a great evening instead :).

I had searched Yelp for burgers and The Richmond popped up. When we arrived we saw that they didn't have the burger on the evening's menu (I'm not sure if that is a permanent thing). But the tasting menu looked so delicious we decided to stay.

And we are so glad we did. The chef, John, came out to greet us and to introduce each course. He also brought us our wine pairings and discussed why he had picked each one.
The ambiance with the hanging curtains struck a great balance of fancy, comfortable, and "mom and pop". It was great to go to as a couple, but I think would also be great for a small business dinner as well. 

And the food and wine choices were simply delicious. The duck, scallop, and tomatoes were all very good, but the salmon with shrimp fritters was especially tasty. It's shrimp reduction was really amazing and it was hard to believe it wasn't cream based. Also, for all the food and wine we received I think the price was quite reasonable.

All in all, it's a place I do plan to return to - and bring friends :).
author: Dave R.

description:
Fantastic 3 course meal for $35 per person! Great value for the price and everything was so tasty especially the appetizers. For the appetizer, the short rib with scallop was so soft and delicious!!! 

Entree- I had the steak medallion and my friend had the duck. Get the duck. Its really good and has a lot of juicy sauce and veggies to go along with it. 

Dessert- loved the chocolate peanut butter torte with ice cream. Also tried the panna cotta and coffee ice cream. They were good but do you want good or the best? Get the best!! 

Ate dinner with 5 of us so instead of the wine pairing, we got 2 bottles of wine and 2 a la carte orders of foie gras (off menu) you can also choose to have that as an appetizer but we chose to share it and get our own apps. The foie gras was AMAZING! I know, it's against your morals, etc. I think as long as you don't overdo it, it's ok to indulge sometimes and to share with others! 

Service was fantastic and we got to try a few different wines with very generous pours! Thanks The Richmond for a fantastic dinner. We really felt like VIPs and loved the value and deliciousness of our meal. I would highly recommend this place :) 

Ps: ask for bread! great date spot. It's quiet, and quite a romantic spot! They separate the restaurant with curtains so you feel like you have your own private space.
author: Joanna S.

description:
ATTENTION: Fellow Foodies, wannabe Foodies, and/or Winos: YOU MUST GO HERE! 
One of my favorite pastimes is to try all the wonderful dining that San Francisco has to offer, and The Richmond ranks up as one of my very top favorites after our experience there (and I have gone to Michelin-starred restaurants like Gary Danko, Lazy Bear, Sons & Daughters, Michael Mina, etc). This place deserves Michelin recognition!

We went on Wednesday night last week to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday and The Richmond made the evening so special and unforgettable. First, from an ambiance standpoint, you should know that it's very small and intimate. Each table is sectioned off with draping that prevents you from seeing (or hearing much) of other diners. I loved this, as it really makes it feel special and you can have a true conversation with who you are with.

Second, the food. AMAZING. We did the 5 course tasting menu. Each course was visually beautiful and everything was delicious. Portions are generous and Chef John also included two additional courses at no cost; I would call them amuse bouches except they were more than just a bite or two, they could definitely have stood alone as courses. It felt more like 7 or 8 courses than 5. You WILL leave full which is always nice when you are spending a good amount on dinner. I always hate when you go somewhere more upscale, pay a lot, and then leave slightly hungry - that won't happen here!
It's really hard for me to pick my favorite course, I loved the foie gras as well as the braised oxtail/scallop dish, but really every dish is unique and well executed. 

Third, the WINE. If you choose to do the wine pairing and have no self-restraint, Chef John will make you incredibly unproductive the day after your meal, because he sure is generous with his pours. Not only did all 5 courses have pairings, he also included wine with the bonus courses, and then even gave us an "extra splash" of our favorite towards the end of the night before the bill because he didn't "want us to feel rushed" (we had one of the last reservations of the night). He made us feel so welcomed (and intoxicated) with these extra touches. 

Finally, Chef John and his wife make a dynamic team. They are so friendly and you can tell that they truly have a passion for food and wine. Chef John was impressively knowledgeable about all of the wines he served us, and he was more than happy to indulge our curiosity about how certain dishes were prepared. 

Bottom line of this novel of a review: This is truly a special dining experience and you should go!
author: Anna J.

description:
This Restaurant is fabulous:
Food is 5 stars
service is 5 stars
ambiance is 4.5 stars
Noise level is 4.5 stars,you can actually hear yourself
Wine is 4.5 stars
the only negative thing is Parking sucks; take uber or lift
we were a table of 8; 4 of us ordered Duck and all agree unlike some restaurants where you get 2-3 slices and pay $40..00 the duck was as good as it gets
Pork loin was tendered according to one of the  guest
Salmon  And Scrimp was also 4.5 stars
try the lemon curd yogurt for desert.... if you like lemon.
we also shared the chocolate wit Peanut Butter lava cake and the peach crisp 
There s just nothing negative to say about this place except for the parking.
Suzan
author: suzan y.

description:
So ridiculously good! Night night. Full review coming soon.

Apparently I can't post my review until I add more text, but this dinner was so good I don't have the desire to do that right now. I just need to bask in the glow. Sitting in an Uber as I write this by the way. Now I'll add some completely unnecessary text just so I can post this review. Blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah. There. Hopefully that does it.

This restaurant is awesome!!!!! More later. Like I said.
author: Rich M.

description:
I'll start off with: service was very good. Oh, and the atmosphere was warm and welcoming: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-richmond-san-francisco#bydXLrzi-u1TLdPlBvh45A

As for the food... well...

I opted for the cheeseburger. It was so... um, meaty. I know that's a weird complaint (I know!) but I just didn't dig it. Either the meat wasn't tasty, or the ratio to condiments/bread was off. It looked good, though: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-richmond-san-francisco#A4ZsbBulcJZbIINKMwKApw

Yeah, the fries? Nope. Snooze-worthy. 

My dining companion went with the pancetta, onion, fennel & brie crispy crepe served with dressed greens, and a side of the butternut squash soup. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-richmond-san-francisco#2OLay8ZsTKrrwjQZ-URfiA). Both were ehh... just OK.

We were still hungry after picking at our mediocre menu items, so we also ordered the corn and brioche custard, smothered with sweet corn sauce (awesome photo Jeanie L.! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-richmond-san-francisco#-a3Ef2-I3J_7fR9evaVLiA) which was the greatest thing there. So tasty!

Since we were non-too-pleased with the savory items, we skipped dessert.

Meh.
author: Adena B.

description:
Living in the neighborhood for the past few years, I have always driven by this place, knowing that I should give it a shot at some time. Every time I checked for a reservation on Opentable a few days in advance, there were never any openings. Luckily, it's easy to know what day my birthday is going to be so my wife and I made a reservation way in advance for earlier this week.

What a treat! It's a very cute restaurant, not very big at all. It's just very quaint, and the staff there from the hostess to the bartender were all very friendly and welcoming.

The menu has some nice variety to it, but I like places that don't give you too many options, and The Richmond is exactly that, with there probably being five options for mains, five for appetizers, etc.

To start, I ordered the scallop and short rib appetizer. I'm not sure what my wife got, but it was good. But before the appetizers came, they delivered us each a small puff pastry from the chef to start the meal. Nice touch - then when they brought out some fresh bread, it came with three different butters. The presentation for everything before our main course was quite nice, and the flavor was wonderful.

Our main courses were good. I had the braised duck, and my wife had the crepe dish. Both of them were really prepared with care, and i was just impressed by how nicely everything was presented.

For dessert, you HAVE to get their peanut butter chocolate torte thing. I may not have the exact name right, but picture a cross between a chocolate lava cake a peanut butter cup. With vanilla ice cream. Really good.

So not only did we find the food quality to be top notch, but the prices were also reasonable. It's not going to break the bank to have a nice dinner for two here. This is just a really great spot for two people to come to dinner. I would definitely get reservations in advance, though. The place is so small. There really were only a handful of tables. I wouldn't want to wait around for one of them to open up. Enjoy!
author: Kevin H.

description: Delicious food! The wine suggestions were perfect. I don't understand how the prices are so low. Makes the rest of the fine dining scene in SF seem like a scam. I like the decor. Intimate and private. Perfect for conversation with good friends. I would come back the next time I want a special meal in Sf.
author: Sheila C.

description:
Wow! What an amazing find and hidden gem. I entertain a lot of clients. When I do I always like to seek out places that create an memorable experience. Well, I think I hit the jackpot when I found this restaurant. 

This is a small little place with a big personality. What was more then amazing was the owners of this establishment. A husband and wife, two incredible people who have a passion to create an experience from beginning to end. They did it all, they greet you at the door, they cook and serve your meal. The food was over the top delicious.

Here is how I know I've hit the jackpot, it's when everyone of your guests can't stop talking about the experience they just had. 

I wish I had the names of this husband and wife. I want to honestly thank them for such an incredible evening! 

I will be back to thank them in person!
author: Bob A.

description: Put aside the venue. If you are about the service and food, this is as great as it gets.
author: Matt S.

description: This place is a gem. It's quaint, quirky, and yummy. The wine pairings are beautiful. The pours are healthy and are impeccably matched with the meals. My boyfriend and I ordered a different prix fixe menu and the staff, knowing that we would share, poured us each a glass for each dish. Each dish was flavorful (we got scallops, crab cakes, steak, and duck) and the portions were great for the price. We walked out stuffed, tipsy, and very happy.
author: Becca M.

description:
I've been needing to update my review to say, in fact, The Richmond IS my FAVORITE RESTAURANT in San Francisco. (Boulevard has been bumped to #2 on my list!) The food is unbeatable; the atmosphere is extremely classy yet friendly; the wine is carefully chosen; the service is perfect. Chef John is incredibly knowledgable -- I learn something new from him every time we chat. And a super guy too --
 you'll never meet a nicer, more humble guy!  Such a brilliant restaurant in the Inner Richmond. This place is high-class, truly the best place to make any evening special.
author: J R.

description: Went here for my friends 30th birthday last night. The food was sooo good! We had a preselected 5 course meal menu. Everything tasted wonderful. Some of my favorites from the evening--the bisque soup, the heirloom tomato salad, and braised short rib with a Maine Scallop which was cooked to perfection. Believe it or not, this was my first time eating scallop and it was very good! I'll have high expectations going forward ;)  This place is great for private birthday parties. We felt like we had the whole restaurant as we pretty much at 20 ppl, we  took it over. Great food and service!
author: Sara K.

description:
We came here for a date night on a Friday night and the neighborhood was quiet. There was a chill vibe in the restaurant, the booths are separated by large drapes so you feel secluded from other patrons.

We ordered the 5 courses. Right off the bat the owner/chef hooked us up with an amuse-bouche, asparagus salad. Then he served us this fried shrimp with a shrimp chip on top. Oh my it was yumtmy. Other highlights are the foie gras and the coffee semifreddo. It would have been fun to get the wine pairing but I'm sure my hubby would have had to carry me out of there.  

I only noticed one other server besides the chef, and they still managed to provide attentive service.
I really enjoyed my experience here, great meal for a great value. Not the place to go if you like a sceny spot for people watching, but it's a great place for a quiet date night.
author: Marilyn C.

description: We had dinner at the Richmond last night, the food was presented well, everything we had was delicious! Would recommend The Richmond if you want good food great service. They do not rush you so plan on spending time enjoying each course. And the curtains add privacy to your dinner experience.
author: Rick V.

description: Went here with friends on a weeknight. The chef was welcoming in the beginning but towards the end of our experience there, attention from them lessened. This was more than a year ago so I don't quite remember the food we ordered. But I remember it was gooood. Love the low keyness of it.  Definitely a good place to go to for some fancy dinner.
author: Claire J.

description:
My Wife's new favorite restaurant!  I hung out in this neighborhood and still frequent all the shops in the Richmond, and never had an inkling that this gem was so close to my office!

Celebrating my birthday last night was even more special thanks to the chef and his wife, service, ambiance, food, quantity and price!  San Franciscans have the unique advantage over other cities because our palates are pretty spoiled.  My thoughts of food around the world are clearly biased and based on my experiences of food tasted in my home town.  With that said...

This place is the BOMB!  
We ordered the appetizer: foie gras with small custard cake(slight surcharge but worth it-not included with the three course meal), scallop and beef, crab cake.  all delightful- melt in your mouth morsels. Never had better seared foie gras,  and better crab cake in my life!
Amuse bouche -soup- was served not in a thimble or a Chinese soup spoon,  but in a classy demitasse which we sopped up with the exquisite baguette bread and butter sides.  We had to stop ourselves from breaking the owners bank by ordering multiple dishes of bread and butter spreads!

Entrees:  Pork chop- bone in with mashed potatoes, hanger steak, and duck. 
All dishes perfectly cooked and seasoned, vegetables were not an afterthought as in other restaurants that I have frequented.  baby book choy mixed in with other sweet veggies really showed a flair for presentation as well as a umami mix.  Portions about 50% larger than I expected for such a "foo foo" place.  After all this is not the usual greasy spoon places where quantity takes a back seat to quality and ambiance.  Its a "Grey Poupon" kind of place!  Not that you need it.

Desserts:  Chocolate "lava" cake with peanut butter and ice cream, Apple tart with ice cream, coffee ice cream three ways, grilled angel food cake with lemon and fruits.  My favorite was the lava cake and the apple tart but everything was certainly made with love and tasted it.

If I still drank wine, I would have loved to taste the recommended pairings with the food from what I experienced in the past, the wines were really well priced and even tempted me with the thought process put into the suggestions.  

If you want to get on your "Bougie" without the major throw down, this is the place!

I could eat here every day given that the service, ambiance, prices, and food is "off the hook!"  But I won't because I want to keep this place for the special occasions.  10 out of 10 on my spectrometer for shedding light, intensity and another level of gastronomical heaven that I had not experienced before.

Make reservations because this place serves european style.  The approximate 10 tables are yours for as long as you wish.
author: Curtis L.

description: The service and food are great.  We get here about once a year, not living in SF.  We just celebrated a friend's birthday and it is a perfect place for that.  The restaurant is more quiet than any local restaurant I have been to because of curtains between the tables.  John (the owner/chef, I think) discusses the menu and what you want and accommodates your preferences/needs. Our party of six sampled many of the appetizers and entrees. Every one thought their food was great. I had a rib/scallop appetizer and a steak that were perfect. Also an unusual chocolate peanut butter dessert. Innovative, but not "strange." The price for 3 course dinner and wine pairing was very good compared to equivalent quality.  Our place in SF.
author: Norm W.

description:
I've wanted to go here for awhile and it was more than I ever anticipated. 3 of my closest friends came on an early Saturday evening after our annual painful foot massage and we were ready for an elegant meal. 

The Owner/Chef/Waiter Extraordinaire John waited on our table. Of course he knew the food preparations and the menu inside and out. He also has an excellent understanding of wines. My friend BJ brought two delicious bottles that he picked up in Italy - however, we also tried several of the wines from his wine list - a tasty Picpoul de Pinet from Southern Rhone, a lush RRV Pinot Noir and at some point I just said give me a complex medium tannin red which was superb. 

The four of us split one order of sweetbreads - OMG - rich, crispy and divine. Really a great way to start. Then we ordered 2 Diver Scallops and 2 Crab Cake dishes. The Crab Cakes were huge - all of this was split up and sooo good. 

Then 2 of us had the Duck Leg and 2 had the Steak - Too good to describe, tender melt in your mouth duck all I can say is Mmmmmmmmmm. 

I finished with a Chocolate Peanut Butter torte of sorts - perfect ending. 

The Richmond is a family owned and a family run (everyone is working and doing it well) business. His neice welcomed us in and sat us at this perfect table that had curtains around it for our very own private experience. 

I CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK
author: Rew C.

description: Those who are looking for a quality steak here is definitely worth a visit, as they are head and shoulders above any other.
author: Cameron W.

description: We went here Saturday to celebrate our anniversary and ordered the five course with wine pairing. This was my first time trying a wine pairing and we had a great experience. It was a quiet, relaxing atmosphere provided by John and his staff.
author: N L.

description: Wow! We haven't been this excited about food in a while. Chef John Ha really makes you feel welcomed... just like as if he invited you to his home & he played a great host.
