The food was not super duper fancy just for fancy sake. His food was very thoughtful & executed expertly. Often we try new restaurants that have a couple great appetizers, but then falls short in the entree or desert. Here, that was not the case. We had the 5 course tasting menu & every single dish was delicious yet distinct. Normally this is the point where I point out the highlights from our dinner, but every dish here was a highlight from beginning to end. We just can't wait to go back. Go try them now!
author: Amen C.

description: The Richmond really was as good as it gets.  I'm worried that when everyone finds out about it the prices will double.  I was skeptical when I read the menu and the 3 course meal was under $40.  The food was fantastic.  I am a pescetarian who does not eat shell fish and John catered to my needs.  We went with another couple and it was quiet enough so we could really hear each other.  John makes it a unique an memorable  dining experience.  I'll be back.
author: Beth S.

description: This place is awesome cute and the staff and owners here are hard working and super sweet. The service was great even when they were under pressure. We really enjoyed our time here and the intimacy felt genuine. I highly recommend their wine selection and the bar has awesome character. Thanks much for the time!
author: Kevan O.

description:
Went here last night with a friend, treating me to a birthday dinner...wow, what a treat after an afternoon at the deYoung. 

Dark heavy curtains create an entrance to the storefront...I'm thinking, how useful to shield diners from the cold fog blowing in the door, but immediately, I see that those curtains also surround each table...perfect for carrying on an all evening conversation...no hustle bustle, just an amazingly relaxed experience. Soft music in background, last night it was early Beatles!

Menus arrived with a teeny coffee mug of potato leek soup, just a couple sips to whet the appetite, then the small loaf of crusty warm bread with 3 butters: chive, olive, sweet.

We decided on the 3 course tasting menu, prix fix...and actually affordable at $37. each. We eschewed the paired wine tastings, at $28 since we each had an hours drive home, just had one glass of a tasty zin.

We shared everything: 2 apps: beet and cardomom carrot salad with a thinned goat cheese drizzle, and olive oil drizzle...this was the only dish that was not top notch...carrots and drizzles were wonderful, but the beets were overcooked to the point of mushy. 2nd app was the beef shortrib (off the bone) and scallop on bed of polenta. Sublime. I would never have thought of such a pairing...the beef had been cooking all day, tender and flavorful. The scallop perfectly cooked. 

Entres: Salmon on quenelle of shrimp mouse with a shrimp bisque sauce...amazing infusion of shrimp flavor...wonderful. Duck leg atop mashed potato with broccoli, mushroom sauce. Again, the duck leg was falling off the bone, but not at all dry...fabulous.

Desserts: before the desserts arrived, the waitress/owner brought in a tiny cup of apple crisp with equally tiny scoop of vanilla ice cream with a little lit candle, she had overheard my friend wishing me a happy birthday. (no singing, thank. you.) Very very tasty crisp. Then, here comes the 2 included desserts, we had chosen the coffee semifreddo and the chocolate and peanut butter torte. Nice balance of flavors for all 3, not excessively sweet, intense chocolate and coffee flavors, fresh apple flavor.

We had arrived at 6pm, as we were finishing up dessert, my phone signaled a text...checked the time...it was 930!!! How leisurely this dinner was, non-stop gabbing, alternating with bites, and sips...I would have never guessed so much time had passed...service never felt slow, as the husband and wife owners/chefs/waiters alternated bringing our plates and clearing away.

It was really delicious, the private tables made us feel as if we were the only ones being served, the leisurely timing allowed us to really enjoy the food...if we had been hurried along, we would never have been able to eat so much! 

Highly recommended. Great for date night, with those romantic private tables. But also great anytime conversing with your friends is more important than being seen and people watching.
The owner told us that they are planning to replace the a la carte menu with only the 3 or 5 course tasting menus sometime soon. If I go again, I would take advantage of the a la carte, because as wonderful as the food was, I really ate a little too much. Splitting 2-3a
pps, 1 entre and 1 dessert could have been enough...but, then, which to choose!!!???
author: Lynn C.

description: 3 course w/ wine pairing is amazing! Impeccable food and wine - will recommend to all my friends!
author: Aly S.

description:
Two words: TASTING MENU!

Those words may sometimes be frightening to the pockets. But, at The Richmond you can do a tasting menu for only $49.95, and an additional $24.95 for wine pairings. Uh, yes please! Note: if one person decides to go with the tasting menu, everyone at that table must do the tasting menu. 

T A S T I N G  M E N U

A P P E I T I Z E R
I had the Fresh Crab Cake, and I must say that it was the BEST crab cake I've ever had. You can bet your butt cheeks that I inhaled the divine crab cake within minutes. Yes, minutes. Why minutes and not a minute? I forgot to add that the portions here are not child sized portions. The crab cake was a fairly decent size, and oh so delicious.

E N T R E E
Seared salmon, YUM! Fish is hard to cook, and most of the time the fish has been overcooked. But, not here at The Richmond. The salmon was cooked PERFECTLY, and was oh so buttery and flavorful! Again, the portion was a decent size. 

D E S S E R T
Coffee Semifreddo- coffee ice cream, coffee granite & almond brittle. Honestly, I went with this dessert, because it had almond brittle and ice cream. It was good, but it needed more almond brittle! =P

C O N C L U S I O N
The service was very good, attentive and polite staff and the chef came out to talk to the patrons. He wanted to make sure everyone was enjoying his food, and you could tell he genuinely cared about everyone's opinions. How often do you see a chef walk out from the kitchen to check on his diners? Not very often, right! With the awesome service, and awesome prices, The Richmond will remain on my top list of restaurants in the city. :)
author: Heather C.

description: Amazing! We have been here once before on a recommendation, and decided that it is one of our favorite restaurants. The owner John is personable, knowledgeable and very warm and inviting. The ambiance is relaxing with soft music, and privacy curtains. The food is spectacular, and the wine pairings are perfection. By all means, make a reservation and enjoy an unparalleled experience.
author: Greg S.

description:
What a delightful little place.  I feel like I was being invited to someone's home for dinner.  The chef came out and told us how he will be preparing our dinner.  The environment felt very homely and intimate.  They had about 10 tables or so and the service was just great.  One thing for sure, you won't be leaving hungry!

B: Steak - it was okay I suppose my fault for medium well but that's what I like!  the potatoes were perfectly sauteed 

B+: Crab cake - lightly fried, good aioli sauce to compliment

A: Scallop - so soft and tender

A+: Desserts - you really can't go wrong with any of them.  

Get the wine tasting too, generous pour! I would totally recommend for an intimate date! Come hungry!
author: Lynda L.

description:
I knew we were meant to eat there when we FOUND A PARKING PLACE DIRECTLY ACROSS THE STREET!  Sorry, I just had to yell it.  We came in to this tiny spot for a 6:30 reservation and only one other two top was seated.  Shortly after we arrived that couple seemed to have some sort of tiff regarding vegetarian items and the woman patron stomped out, leaving her embarrassed dinner companion to eat his giant hamburger by himself.

The owner, his wife and niece all provided service.  We chatted and introduced ourselves.  I kept wondering how the food was getting cooked since John (owner/chef) presented almost every dish and poured every glass of wine.  It was a lovely touch, though, and made us feel pampered.

We got the Chef's tasting menu and the wine pairing, both incredibly values at $50 for the food and just $25 for the wine (3 oz pours, but they warn you and that's enough when having 5 glasses).  John brought us one extra glass of chenin blanc when we sat down so we wouldn't be sitting there with nothing to drink/eat while we awaited the start of the meal.  Very nice touch:

Amuse bouche 4.5: 
the cutest little ham and cheese sammy ever -  a tiny piece of brie wrapped in thinly sliced ham in between two pieces of puff pastry.  It was about one inch square, no more, and would have been perfect if the cheese were just a tad softer/warmer.

Extra course, just because he was trying out a new recipe 4: 
 Butternut squash soup - let it be know, I am not a fan of any of those large baking squashes or pumpkin.  Despite that, this soup was very good, incredibly silky, gorgeous color, and the top off of earthy, crunchy, toasted pumpkin seeds went a long way to offset the sweetness of the gourd.

 Roasted Beets & Cardamom Carrot Salad topped with Laura Chenel goat cheese in phyllo pastry 4.5: 
Well my husband, who never eats beets liked them, and I, who am not terribly fond of goat cheese thought the little chevre purse was delightful.  The two of us, who mostly like our carrots raw, thought in this preparation with cardamom they were delicious

Softshell crab set on a spinach salad 4.5: 
The menu called for a crab cake, but John said he had softshell crab and wondered if we'd like to try it.  Well he didn't have to ask twice, since we're both big fans.  These crab were perfectly cooked and tasted so fresh and wonderful.  He said he was still perfecting the recipe, but I think it was already there!  One small change I'd make is to leave out the pieces of hard cooked egg in the spinach salad.  They made it a little too rich; maybe better with the crab cake.

Whisky Braised Oxtail & Maine Diver Scallop on creamy polenta 5:
I've seen similar combos before, and frankly I think I'd prefer either one or the other.  The oxtail (it actually seemed more like a piece of short rib to me, but doesn't really matter) was deeply flavored and perfect texture - wonderfully tender, but not at all stringy.  The scallop was well cooked too, but a little overpowered by the rich meat sauces, and the polenta was creamy, but still had a little bit of texture - loved it

Braised Duck Leg in a Port Wine Sauce 5:  I'm a big duck fan, especially the crispy skin.  Well this preparation was obviously not crispy, but left the duck meat with a silky and earthy. As my dear departed mom used to say, just ducky!

Palate cleanser 3.5: raspberry granite with fresh strawberries- cleansed the palate, but had very little flavor.  Pretty color though

Coffee ice cream, coffee granite, coffee cream, & almond brittle 4.5:  More elaborate than most semiffredo, liked the brittle.  This was a great way to end the meal.

We enjoyed ourselves immensely, but felt sorry for the poor deserted diner, who was standing out on the sidewalk when we left.  I guess his date took the car as well as spoiling the dinner.

Food:  37/40
Service 20/20
Atmosphere/Intangibles: 17/20
Value: 20/20
overall:94/100!
author: Diane B.

description:
I enjoyed this place. A couple of things to note:
The menu rotates, so if you see something online and do not get your heart set on it. It may be there. It may not.

One trait I liked about this restaurant is it is slow paced and relaxed in a way that they actually want you to stay and enjoy your dinner. They are not concerned with having people dine and then cash out immediately. 

We opted to do the three course meal which was a great deal if you plan on doing apps, entrees and dessert. 
Once you order, they will bring out a sampling size of soup. 
I had the pear/walnut/blue cheese salad. I really like tart salads. 
For dinner I had spice rubbed chicken. I personally loved the chicken. It had a crispy outside without that really fried and breaded chicken taste but wasn't dry or overcooked. 
My dessert I ordered because the woman at the table next to me raved for seriously 10 minutes to her dinner guests. I wasn't in love with my dessert the way she was. It was a sort of mousse with blended ice and almond brittle. I just thought the ice it in was distracting and took away from the mousse. But different strokes for different folks. 

$22 for a bottle of wine. Three course meal was $35 each. Decent prices for the amount of food we ate. Check this place out!
author: Kim S.

description:
The amount of high quality food and wine that one receives here is truly astounding for the price - exceptional value.  We had the 3 course tasting with a wine pairing and everything was absolutely delicious.  If you're hungry and enjoy food that is on the rich side, you will LOVE your meal - we did. The place seems to be run completely by two people alone (including the chef), and they really do treat you like you're in their home - incredibly sweet, welcoming, considerate and attentive as they can be.  The pacing is a touch slow because of the lack of staff, but we certainly didn't mind - we had plenty of food and wine to hold us between courses.  The only area for improvement is in decor, which could use a serious face lift.  
If I lived closer, I'd go frequently and probably gain many lbs.  
Yum!!!
author: Ellen H.

description:
This restaurant has been in the neighborhood for 13 years and why did I just discover it? Look, I'm probably not adding anything new to what anyone is saying when I say this couple does food right and genuinely makes you feel welcome.  They (husband and wife) don't book to fill all the seats but enough so that they can provide good service. That being said: make reservations or call before you plan to drop in to see if they can accommodate you.

Highlights: that chive butter w/bread, complimentary bisque was so smooth, the crab cake that was so creamy, short-rib nice and soft, perfectly cooked med/rare NY steak without asking (took a chance by not asking)... ok I should stop. 

I may not be able to come here often but I'm looking forward to try that 5 course tasting menu.
author: david n.

description:
This is my second time at the The Richmond and it is still as good as the first time. 

This time, it was for my gf and I's birthday, we took our beaus there as a thank you for spoiling us at our birthdays. 

The foi gras is a must have as all of us are big fans of it. It melts in your mouth and the balance of fatty and sweet is perfect. Can't say it's as good as La Folie, but it's a very close second. 

All the portions are big (like regular size unlike other fancy restaurants)! We thought we can do the 5 course menu, but with the 3 course and the extra foi gras, left all of us left very very full. 

Since it was a wine bar, we definitely had some wine. Don't know much about wine, so we stuck with white, but will for sure try the pairing next time. 

Overall, the food is really good bang for its buck. We will definitely be returning to see what the chef have in store for us. He told us to expect cheeese! =) 

appetizer:
crab cakes and salad
beet salad
scallops with pork

Entree:
Salmon 
Steak Medallion (this was HUGE)
Duck (So delicious)

Dessert:
Peach crumble
Panna Cotta
Coffee Semifreddo
Peanut Butt Torte.
author: Hei Ming C.

description:
Love, love, love the service, food and friendly, family feel of the place while very classy. :) Love how the owner really comes over to talk and check up on you throughout the time you're there. When we arrived for our reservation, there were parties before us who were finishing up after dining for over 3 hours. So the owners offered us some complimentary summer wine at the bar as we waited for our table to free up. That's fine with a wait like that and the owner was chatting with us and keeping us entertained. I was excited to try the food after great ambience and treatment so far. Menu is refined and options are all so yummy. We had the choice of 3 ($50) or 5 ($65) course menu--not bad for fine dining and multiple course meal including an appetizer starter, entree and dessert. We had a cute window seat table in front in this relatively small restaurant as it is. That's what makes it cute and quaint. :) Owner apologized for front part as they have plans to renovate the wine cellar, but we didn't even notice anything sore to the eyes upon entry. Back to the food, took a little while to come out because they were busy. It was worth the wait! The starter scallops and short rib on top of mash was delicious! My girlfriend even ordered an extra dish of that with her 3 course...lol I can see why. The crab cake salad was good, but rather so-so compared to the scallop and short rib. Main entree we had the duck and steak medallions that rocked...so flavorful and tender. I had tried the pork chop and it was huge! I personally didn't like the flavorful profile of this one compared to the other dishes and I got tired of eating it after a whole because the portion was just a bit too big for me personally. If you like pork with a bone and hungry, try this one out. :) As for dessert, all the ones we ordered were delicious. We had the chocolate lava cake with peanut butter inside and a scoop of ice cream (great for chocolate lovers; bit on the sweet side for me but the ice cream helped balance the chocolate), fruit parfait (refreshing fruit and light cream), and the coffee cup crisp (very interesting textures of crunch and soft cream blend for a yummy coffee flavored dessert).

Keep in mind, the owner and chef would modify the menu according to what is seasonal and best ingredients available the time of the year. It is what makes this place special. :) I would highly recommend and plan to spend some time enjoying your dining experience here as it would probably easily take you about 3 hours well spent here.
author: Christine N.

description:
Quiet, intimate, small restaurant with tables partitioned off by thick curtains. Plan to make a reservation.

Delicious, well-prepared food and a great wine selection at normal-fancy-restaurant (as opposed to San Francisco-fancy-restaurant) prices. 

Service wasn't *quick*, but most of the time we were being attended by the chef (owner?) himself, so the personal attention made up for the leisurely pace. Go when you want dinner to be the focus of your evening, not when you're trying to eat and dash off to your next event.
author: William C.

description:
4.5 stars, 5 for ambiance and 4 for food.  

Came here for the first time on Saturday for date night with the wife.  Because of babysitting needs, we came for an early dinner, and we would have walked except for the hard rain so we drove.  We found parking across the street, which I know it was a stroke of luck, we live in the neighborhood so we know how difficult it can be to park.  Can't fault a neighborhood restaurant for the lack of parking.  You can't have the cake and eat it too!

The ambiance is very intimate and cozy, making it the perfect spot for a date, a romantic evening with your special one.  It is not the perfect place for a group dinner, or loud revelers.  It has a small bar, so it can double up for a drink with the wife sans the meal in the future.  

The food was excellent, quite scrumptious actually.  Very reasonably priced, for the quality and the small size.  I believe I saw only one entree starting with a 2.  We had the rib and scallop and the crab cake appetizers.  I had the duck leg for entree, and my wife just had the crab cake and seasonal vegetables as her entree (not a big eater).  The crab cake was served in a bowl and a sauce, which made it a bit soggy, although it tasted great.  This is the only issue we had with the meal.  The rest was fabulous, and we appreciated the flexibility to carve out the seasonal veggies, which are part of another entree, to special serve them to my wife without the rest of the entree.  

The wine list presents a surprisingly affordable selection.  Expensive bottles are at hand if it is your preference.  But where else in San Francisco do you find a restaurant that only doubles the retail price instead of tripling it?

Service was impeccable.  We will be back.
author: Massimo M.

description:
Aah yes... dinner date with just the siblings... long overdue and this place was perfect!

I made the res via opentable.com... it's SF and it was a Friday night... must get a res if you want to eat on time...

We walked in... friendly host / server and the chef was behind the bar reassuring us that we'll be seated in 2 minutes. Siblings and I reassured him that we weren't in no rush.

We got seated in the 2nd room...folks... this is a major DATE place! Almost everyone around us that night were either a couple or they were on their first dates (ie: the couple behind us b/c the lady was all decked out!)

Anyway... service was prompt and friendly...

Siblings and I got the following:

- Seared Sonoma Foie Gras with apple sauce & pain perdu = by no means that this compares to La Folie... but it was decent... I ended up ordering this b/c my sis said it would go perfect with the Cristal that she was going to order. Me: why yes, of course dear sis... I shall get it. And the sis knows me well - it was indeed perfect. Bite of this... a sip of the Cristal... heightened taste palate indeed! My bro had it and his response: "Oh my gosh, that just melts in your mouth!" Needless to say... he finished half of it.

- Wild Pacific Salmon (with ratatouille & tomato cream sauce) = I wasn't feeling the rest of the entree choices so I opted to go light with salmon and it didn't disappoint... it was tasty - well seasoned and fresh. The veggies were an added bonus.

- Fresh Cream Panna Cotta with apple cream topped with lemon curd & streusel = DELICIOUS! By far my favorite panna cota and trust me when I say that... every time I have dinner with the siblings we're always on a mission to find the best and I think this was the winner. The streusel on top added a new flavor to its creamy goodness!

The chef walked around thanked all the patrons that was still eating and he was really down to earth and friendly. 

NOTE: if you're buying a bottle of wine ... double check that you're getting the right one... our server almost popped open the wrong Cristal and good thing my sis caught it in time. 

Definitely a date place and well worth it to check out...make sure you make a reservation... it's a tiny place! And the place tends to be on the quiet side... so not a good place to catch with people you haven't seen for ages just so you won't annoy the other patrons...
author: Cath M.

description:
The Richmond continue to rock and you are really not a true San Franciscan until you dine under the supervision of this chef. We came tonight for the 50th anniversary of my folks, and as the six of us could not decide what try, we pretty much ordered the entire menu and shared (in a clockwise motion) all the apps, and most of the mains. There weren't any loser dished, everything was cooked brilliantly and perfectly, true mastery in the kitchen. Highlights are the sweetbread apps (makes fried chicken seem boring), the beets, the heirloom tomatoes (how do they always get the perfect tomatoes) and the scallop/shortrib combo. For mains, well, let's just say the duck will make tofu jealous for how tender and soft it is. The service can be slow depending on the number of servers, so plan to enjoy this place for a while.
Love this spot, will return for the good food and good times.
author: Brian J.

description:
3.5 stars based on our recent experience
Hubby and I decided to visit the city, Richmond is on my list to try based on the high ratings. It was an enjoyable dinner but not quite at 4 stars imho.

We had a very difficult time finding parking, circled the blocks at least 3 times finally parked at Geary and 6th. This challenge may have dampened our enthusiasm a bit, but the brisk walk in the cold was definitely good for our cardios.

We were the first to arrive at this very cozy place, it was nothing fancy but we felt comfortable. Both the busboy and the waiter seem relatively new, very friendly and attentive.  I was a little disappointed that the menu was shorter then what's on the website, they removed the oysters and replaced ox tail with short rib. The crusty bread and flavored butter were very tasty.We had a harvest salad and short rib with scallop for starters, both were delish especially the scallop I was hungry for more.

Our mains were the hanger steak and salmon; both dishes were decent but on the salty side for our tastes. The steak was good but a little chewy, hubby didn't enjoy the cubed potatoes and cream spinach came with the steak. in hindsight perhaps we should pay $5 more for the NY. The salmon was grilled to perfection. I also liked the mushroom slices and string beans. We ordered wine by the glass and it was good. 

We liked the starters better then the main but overall a good place to have an enjoyable meal. Wish the parking is a little easier.
author: Julie W.

description:
So good, soo good!

I had done a little search on wine bars near Laurel Heights and The Richmond popped up as both that and a local dining must. Realizing it gets booked pretty quick due to size, we made a reservation and enjoyed a perfect date night at this cozy little corner.

The food was delectable - I mean seriously every bite. The braised short rib with diver scallops just fell apart on my fork and the seared hanger steak was cooked to perfection. They have a vast list of wines both by the bottle and half bottle (always a plus) which paired perfectly with the warm chocolate and peanut butter torte (I know, sounds ridiculous).

So don't bother reading any more reviews. Just get yourself booked for a night of infinite indulgence. Ready, go!
author: Caroline S.

description: attentive and intimate service, a well-paced meal that doesn't break the bank. will be back, glad places like this exist in my 'hood!
author: Ashley G.

description: Great food and even better service. We went here to celebrate our anniversary for our second visit and loved every moment. The prices are extremely reasonable and especially for the large portions they serve. John is wonderful and extremely knowledgeable of his wines. We had the five course with wine pairing and without even having to ask, John decided to give us different food items and wine to go with them so we could both try everything. We highly recommend this place and will be back very soon.
author: Jen L.

description: The Richmond never disappoints. I first dined here soon after they first opened and ever since it has been my restaurant of choice for special occasions it just when I want a delicious meal that I know won't disappoint. The chef and his wife run the restaurant and together they offer a very personalized experience. Their staff is exceptional and friendly. I recommend doing one of the tasting menus (options are 3 course or 5) with the wine pairing. It's fabulous and you'll learn about the wines. And they serve one of the most decadent foie gras dishes, served atop french toast.
author: Lindsey L.

description: Exceeded my expectations by FAR in every respect - service, food and ambiance. The owner\manager - John, was very helpful, friendly and attentive. There were only a few other tables in the place at 8:30 on a weeknight. It felt like we were dining in someone's house. Very cozy and attractive restaurant. I cannot believe this place has been here for 14 years and I never knew about it. We will definitely be back. Any restaurant that has this high a rating after so many years has something special, and The Richmond delivers. The food was delicious - we had the 3 course tasting menu, and could not eat another bite after dessert. Generous portions, and John split one of the starters 3 ways for me, my wife and my mother who were all celebrating birthdays. Very generous wine pours as well. This is not a place to get a quick bite - this is an experience to savor, so be patient, and you will be rewarded with a unique dining experience in San Francisco. I can't believe they don't even have a website. That such a place can even exist in this day and age is amazing. The value is excellent - in many other restaurants, you'll pay the same amount for one dish as you pay for the 3 course menu at The Richmond. Can't wait to come back!
author: Larry B.

description: We went here last week to celebrate my daughter's birthday and the whole evening was wonderful. From the moment we came in (early) until we left, the personal attention we received from the chef/owner and his wife was outstanding. We were happy with every dish we ordered and really appreciated the wine suggestions that were made and poured. Excellent!
author: Simone M.

description:
Amazing all around!! This review is well overdue but better late than never. The Richmond is a small, intimate space, family-run. It really is a very romantic little place for dinner to celebrate a special occasion. 

The food was exquisite. We did the wine pairing menu. It starts with an amuse-Boucher, compliments of the chef. The steak we had was spot on, medium rare goodness. For dessert, we had the affogato, which was both rich and sharp in flavor.

The real gem of this place is the chef and his wife. The chef delivers the food to you himself, so food does actually come out slower than most places, but it's part of the charm. He explained every wine to us in detail and didn't mind when we chatted with him a little longer about his family and the business.  This is the most memorable service in the city for us. 

Can't wait to come back!
author: Mark T.

description:
First time dining here - pleasantly surprised.  Very cozy, excellent service, and great food.

Will definitely come back.  Besides great food - the portions are very generous
author: Jennifer T.

description:
This place is amazing!

I came here on Thursday night for my teammate's birthday. The restaurant is extremely cozy, romantic and homey.

We got started with the whiskey braised oxtail with a Maine diver scallop. Before we got our real appetizer we were given complementary deviled eggs and bread with an assortment of butters. Calamata olive, butter with coarse sea salt and chive. My favorite was the calamata. :) I ordered the double down pan fried chicken with stuffing entree (don't remember what its called o_o). And teammate ordered the seared salmon with veggies (don't remember what this was called either). (They should update their online menu??) For dessert we had the apple turnover. (Why do I always order this? lol)

My chicken entree was really good and filling. I enjoyed the crisp of the chicken and the breaded stuffing in between. Teammate's salmon was good too, it was all in one piece when you dug your fork into it and didn't split into little pieces that just stuck to your plate. The apple turnover was really good. I tend to order desserts that come with ice cream. The apple turnover was flaky and warm.

I'd definitely come back here.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Wow talk about a diamond in the rough. There aren't too many fine dining restaurants like this in the Richmond, so if you live in the area you are in luck! Made dinner reservations for 6 on a Saturday night, and I was looking for a place that was a little more intimate so that we could all converse without yelling at each other. This place was perfect, small and cozy. The chef and owner John is great, and he makes time to talk to his patrons. This place is a true neighborhood restaurant, and you can't find too many places like it in the city. 

Food: 
Great quality and value is what comes to mind when I think of this place. I started with the butternut squash soup. This was creamy and delicious. The bread that they brought complimented this soup perfectly. Next I had the burger, which was absolutely delicious. The bread was toasted and the meat was extremely juicey. All the condiments were homemade and complimented my burger nicely. For dessert I had the panna cotta. This was good, but not my favorite. What really caught my attention was the coffee semifreddo. My girlfriend had that and it was absolutely delicious. I tried to sneak another bite, but I was too late. 

Whether you are looking for a nice family dinner on a Saturday night, or you are looking to take that special someone out on a nice date for a special occasion. This place is an all purpose restaurant, and I can see myself definitely coming back here.
author: Alex L.

description: One of the best meals I have ever had in San Francisco. Incredible food and restaurant. Nicest people. Warmed my heart.
author: Michelle T.

description: I liked it. Great charming family run place. I can't say there was anything particular that stood out but I like them. :) This is all subjective...
author: Vicki T.

description:
I recently came to the Richmond with my family to celebrate my sister and my birthday. I have to say that it was quite a pleasant experience. It was located in a cute little restaurant with a nice atmosphere.

We decided against the tasting menu and chose to order individual items instead. We started with the crab cakes and braised oxtail with scallops. We thought that they were excellent, but the portion size was rather small. The complimentary bread is fantastic here though, and it comes with a few nice spreads including an olive spread, butter, and a pesto spread.

For our main course, we shared several entrees:
Crispy Skin Pan Fried Chicken: The chicken was quite tender and the crispy skin was very flavorful. This dish was very delicious, definitely one of the better chicken dishes that I've had.
Wild Pacific Salmon: The salmon was quite moist and cooked very well. I thought that it could use more seasoning though, as there wasn't that much flavor.
Linguini and Clams: This is probably one of the best linguini and clams I've ever had. The flavor of the sauce on the linguini complemented the noodles well. Also, the noodles were cooked to a perfect tenderness.
Hanger Steak: This steak was rather bland and tough. I would recommend paying the extra $5 for the NY Steak, which is substantially more tender. I would recommend going for the steak cooked medium, or more undercooked if you're a fan of that. 

We ended our meal with the Warm Chocolate and Peanut Butter Torte. It was quite delicious as well! Definitely worth the wait if you're a peanut butter fan, there's a little bit of peanut butter in the center. It's rather dense and heavy for a concluding dessert, but had a pleasant sweetness to it.

Overall, the food was quite good and reasonably priced. In addition, the service was excellent as well. It's a cute shop that I would definitely consider revisiting. Sadly they don't seem to have any specials for birthdays, which would have been nice.
author: Michael L.

description:
Came here for new years eve. had reservations and were seated immediately. The place is very intimate. It's a really good place for a date. We came here to get away from the mission on NYE. we had the 5-course. John the owner came and greeted us, went over a couple of wines, gave us two to try that he knew we didn't want, but wanted us to try anyways to pave the way to his pick! wow, service. He told us about the tasting menu, and told us he wouldve been switching the fish since he didn't like what the market had that day. He was incredible at taking care of his patrons. He paid so much attention. We started off with a butternut squash soup with roasted pumpkin seeds, this was probably my favorite thing.. beet salad, not a big fan myself. corn brioche was good, braised duck and coffee semifreddo. Food was great, wouldve done without the corn brioche and beet salad.

In all honesty my girlfriend and I had drank two bottles of wine before coming here and finished a 3rd there. So yes, it was a great night. The food probably might have been better if we hadn't drank so much but eh. We actually boxed the last course which I felt sort of rude doing but we really wanted to get home since we were a bit buzzed. Anyways, I would still definitely come back, the staff is amazing, the place is a gem, john is an amazing owner, and for $50/person 5-course, it's absolutely worth it.
author: Elton F.

description: Don't usually write reviews, but I'll make an exception for The Richmond.  We were there with friends last evening and had an unforgettable experience. Great wine list, service and exquisite food!  Thank you John for your generosity and attention to detail.  All of the reviews we read said we would love this place, and we did. The 5 course tasting menu was incredible!  I especially loved the Foie Gras, the salad with the pear vinaigrette and the coffee frozen dessert.  The only thing we didn't like is the complete lack of parking in this neighborhood, which is certainly not the restaurant's fault.  Plan ahead if you are driving, and allow some extra time for parking.  We will be back!  Still smiling!
author: J S.

description: LOVE this little gem in the Richmond.  Food is fresh, simple and downright delicious. Great wine selection, and the staff makes you feel like you're family.  Totally adorable.
author: Justin F.

description:
Creepy

The Richmond has a very strange atmosphere, with heavy dark curtains surrounding each table. If you like dining in isolation, this is the place. I ordered the salmon which came on a bed of what tasted like undercooked, pickled vegetables. On the plus side, generous pours of average tasting wine, presided over by the chef who sniffed the bottle before each pour, sometimes touching his nose to it. Overall a David Lynch sort of experience.
author: Kristin J.

description: The food and services were both good and it was reasonably priced.  We had the fived course  with wine pairing.  The wines paired very well with each dish. Love the foie gras, perfectly seared and complimented with an apple reduction sauce. Love the contrast of sweet and savory taste.  The dessert was a coffee and vanilla ice cream topped with Almond Roca bits and it was delicious. The whole experience was very good.
author: Wil M.

description: I love The Richmond. It's one of my favorite restaurants in the city, because it has a great ambiance. It's very intimate, with beautiful curtains sectioning off parts of the restaurant. Amazing place for a date. The owner and his wife provide fantastic service and wine pairing, and really do a great job explaining the wines that are chosen and their process. The food has been great and consistent. Definitely a go-to spot on Balboa. I like the music they play too!
author: Ryan Y.

description:
Good food and polite service!!!

My family and friends enjoy going to the Richmond for dinner.  If they ever serve lunch, we would go in a heart beat too.  The owner John takes orders, explains everything on the menu, and honors special requests.  Then he goes to the kitchen to make sure all dishes are cooked as ordered.  His charming wife brings out the food and helps cooking and plating in the kitchen.  We often order the $36 per-person prix fix menu (choose 1 from 5 appetizer options, 1 from 5 entree options and 1 from 4 desert options).  We love the following dishes:

Appetizers
Crabcake with spinach salad
Beet salad
Braised short rib in creamy polenta
Corn brioch pudding

Entree
New York steak
Duck with mashed potatoes
Salmon (he changes up the style and it is good anyway he does it)

It is hard to get a reservation at the restaurant because John never overbooks his tables.  He makes sure each party has at least 2 hours of gastronomic bliss.  He strives for quality over quantity.  Therefore, my family love to eat here twice monthly.  We take our time savoring everything - the table linen, silverware, glassware, each dish as it comes out.  What a charming neighborhood restaurant.
author: G D.

description: This place is wonderful , Friendly, knowledgable of wine and the organic food resource, The food is so amazing. We had the three course meal  with our friends and it was to die for. everything from the start to the finish of the meal delicious, and mouth watering. The wine selection was amazing too, Great pairing with the whole meal. Wow and the Chef was awesome , his attention to detail was perfect, he  personalized his attention to each one of us. Amazing services. We would give him and our experience 10 Starts  if we could. Everyone needs to try this place. Service, Wine and Food AMAZING
author: Christen G.

description:
We originally had reservations for four, but one of our friends couldn't make it. Once I arrived, I told her hostess/server that there would only be three. When our third friend came, we kept waiting for imaginary fourth friend to arrive until the chef took our order. I still don't get why our server couldn't take our order when we told her we were ready multiple times. 

The food was mediocre, nothing to rave about. The highlight was probably their butter spread, but even that was kind of cold and frozen. The weird thing was how my friend's iced tea came out toward the end of the dinner, and it tasted like metallic. 

It was really hard to get our server's attention throughout the meal. Hence, the late iced tea. She comp'd it, but that was probably because it tasted like liquid metal. Or maybe we were given intervals of the silent treatment and lack of attention from our server because she was waiting near the door to welcome our fourth imaginary friend who never showed up. Clearly, she was smartest one out of us four.
author: Jen N.

description: If you live in the neighborhood I think it's probably OK to eat at the Richmond. if you don't live in the neighborhood, I recommend not making the trip because it's mediocre in every aspect. The staff is  not great, The Decour is dated, Food is uninspired, bland, and misrepresented. The chef really doesn't know how to cook some of the things that he has on the menu.
author: Julie N.

description:
04/13/2013

This is fine dinning done with passion, and done right! If you're looking for something French, The Richmond is the place to go. Though not really French cuisine (more on the fusion side), the food is superb and well prepared.

6PM Reservation: an associate had called me 2 hours before service regarding our reservation, and he was genuine over the phone - which is always great to hear. 

We were promptly seated on the western side (The Richmond occupies two store/spaces). The ambiance is great, with low lighting, velvet red/blackish drapes, and we sat near a beautiful painting (which I uploaded to YELP) with extruding molded tree branches.

Originally we went in wanting a large meal, but because my friends aunt fed her snacks prior to meeting up (Chinese families never know when to stop feeding their guest), so we opted to each order a main course, and an appetizer to share (we both love to eat, and so this was an experience).

*A bowl of citrus juices and carrot juice/slivers were served as a palette cleanser. It almost resembled a gazpacho, and I wanted more!

1. Crab Cake (portion was on the bigger side, but there was only one [I would have liked a second], super fresh crabs with celery and citrus of lemon]. I loved my crab cake without anything on it / my friend drizzled some lemon juice for added moisture.

2. Braised Brisket in red wine sauce, diver scallop, and a bed of polenta (superbly delicious, melts in your mouth, simply falls off, scallop cooked perfectly, and polenta was an excellent pairing). I almost wished that this be a meal itself.

3. We both ordered: Duck Leg in red wine sauce, medley of vegetables and mashed potatoes (wow, the duck leg fell off the bone without any force from my fork, and I loved the sauce on the mashed potatoes just as I do with turkey and gravy). My friend and I sat there with moments of silence because we were deeply intertwined with our food.

A dessert menu was brought to our attention after the clearing of plates. On YELP (unfortunately, an out dated menu) listed Panacotta as a dessert option, of which we both wanted. All of the other dessert seemed delicious, but we really wanted Panacotta, and so left dessert out for the night.

Fine dining is a must, and The Richmond lives up to its praise. What's next on my list, CHAPEAU!
author: Alex C.

description:
We just had an INSANE experience here. Something was clearly going on behind the scenes because the chef waited on us and the waitresses were just kind of wandering around a mostly empty restaurant. Drinks took forever and he said he was giving us a glass of wine on the house. 

The next thing we know, we heard the chef full on SCREAMING at the staff in the kitchen. It went on and on and on about how the servers were fucking up and how they obviously didn't care about "their futures" and how things were finally "going good" and the staff was fucking it the fuck up. 

What made it even worse was that there were only a few parties in there at that point, and everyone was just kind of awkwardly waiting around for their food, which for us took about an hour for a cheeseburger and a vegetable turnover. One poor woman had been waiting to pay for awhile, and she ended up having to go into the kitchen to hand off her credit card, which only incited more screaming from the chef. 

The future here seems bleak, Chef, if you treat your staff like that and don't seem to care if your customers overhear your rage. 

Oh, and we were charged for that glass of wine anyway. But we were happy to throw down some cash and get the hell out of there.
author: Sara A.

description:
We had a large group party last night and the chef and staff could not have been nicer.  The food was delicious and extremely reasonably priced.  

I had the 3 course tasting menu --- a rich and creamy corn brioche pudding (so good!), a big bone-in pork roast with lots of veggies, and a very yummy chocolate peanut butter torte.

A wonderful neighborhood restaurant run by people who really care about their customers.  Looking forward to going back!
author: Anne M.

description:
So unassuming...so unexpected...so good! 

When one of my buddies suggested The Richmond for dinner one night, I really didn't know what to expect.  Without the benefit of reading some reviews beforehand, I was only able to go with what I skimmed through on the ride there - great quality for the money, terrific service, and they served foie (sold!).

Walking in, the place is rather quaint.  Modest but not small, not busy but not dead...just the way I like it.  Seated at a table by the door with a curtain draped around it, it was pretty nice to have a semi-secluded area to ourselves.  If only I was there on a date instead of with a couple of my childhood friends...

After skimming through the menu, I was pleasantly surprised by the friendly prices - appetizers averaging around $9 (not counting the foie) and entrees for $20?  Fair prices and good food make the best combination of all.

- Bread with Regular, Chive, and Olive Butter (free) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/1KbZaqEdZkn6LHlA55M64g?select=1xEIzijgxhJ6OXPg9dI-SQ#8dLcrpiMf18yqf3odx0fQQ) - not a huge part of the meal, but it was pretty different.  The olive butter was okay (not a huge fan of olives), but I liked the chive butter a lot.
- Julienne Carrots and Mango with Cilantro and Carrot Juice Amuse-bouche (free) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/1KbZaqEdZkn6LHlA55M64g?select=1xEIzijgxhJ6OXPg9dI-SQ#fab2IPo6G7l9epu1aTi-8A) - Simple, but I liked the crisp, refreshing flavor.  A nice way to cleanse the palate before the main part of the meal.
- Seared Artisan Foie Gras with a Foie & Chicken Mousseline Raviolo and Black Truffle Sauce ($17) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/1KbZaqEdZkn6LHlA55M64g?select=1xEIzijgxhJ6OXPg9dI-SQ#4Hv-jf4ZPrFH05TTb3qKuQ) - my favorite of the night, partly because foie was everywhere.  The piece of foie gras was a little small, but it was seared nicely and had just the right richness.  The raviolo was terrific - I never knew foie and chicken made for such a delicious pair!
- Pork Tenderloin & Swedish Meatball Roti with Potato Puree ($19) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/1KbZaqEdZkn6LHlA55M64g?select=1xEIzijgxhJ6OXPg9dI-SQ#RFyeZBCUCGOSBVLot0wA8w) - if meatloaf and turducken had a child, this would be it.  The meatballs wrapped inside the  tenderloin were juicy and flavorful (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/1KbZaqEdZkn6LHlA55M64g?select=1xEIzijgxhJ6OXPg9dI-SQ#7T1twZ3FCo-i3GoF01Jcng), while the pork exterior stayed tender and moist.  A little meat heavy, but it was good.
- Coffee Semifreddo (Coffee Ice Cream, Coffee Granite, and Almond Brittle) ($6) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/1KbZaqEdZkn6LHlA55M64g?select=1xEIzijgxhJ6OXPg9dI-SQ#oyEqOY5cYGoBlfPGNecyWg) - the first few bites were filled with ice crystals, but they melted away soon enough.  I really liked the coffee flavor and how the brittle added some crunch. 

Beyond the food, the service at The Richmond is just as impressive.  Our waiter and the owner were very friendly and came by often to check on us.  Even the chef came by our table after our entrees were served just to see how we liked the food.  While it can get lost amongst the other restaurants in the area, The Richmond shouldn't be overlooked.  FOUR AND A HALF STARS for the food, but rounding up for the service.  Most definitely worth checking out, even if parking can be a little tough.
author: Mike L.

description:
My boyfriend and I had the 3 course menu here. 

Delicious food, a very romantic atmosphere and amazing prices.

I had a beet salad with braised duck leg and mashed potatoes; dessert was a decadent brownie with peanut butter filling.

I'd come back - the atmosphere was calm, service was great and the whole experience was smooth.
author: Jen B.

description:
A late review but a memorable experience here nonetheless. I made a visit the on the eve of the foie gras ban. Besides that exquisite dish, I tried: 

- Bread & Butters: a butter flavor for everyone. 
- Cheeseburger & Fries: Juicy and one of the meatiest burgers I've ever had. 
- Pork Tenderloin & Swedish Meatballs: A very classy, but tasty and homestyle kind of dish. 

It is a bit too quiet for me at the restaurant but service was good. Overall, I love that the prices here are affordable for a nice sit-down quality meal. 

Au revoir foie gras.
author: Maya S.

description:
Not sure why this place isnt flooding with business because its perfect for an intimate date or if you want to catch up with friends without having to shout over your table, WITH delicious food and reasonable prices. Also, the service is impeccable. In short, its a neighborhood gem. 

Both times I have gotten the Pancetta Crepe de Brick and Crispy Skin Pan Fried Chicken which were both finger lickin good but what really sealed the deal was the CHEESECAKE - don't even question it, just do it.

I swear, you'll thank me.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Trust the reviews.  Fine dining with good portion sizes and wine pairings.  One of the best and most memorable meals in San Francisco.
author: Hotung T.

description: The food was mediocre, this place is in a residential area, dark and inconspicuous. Service was fine but parking was hard. Don't think I'm coming back here anytime soon.
author: SJ L.

description:
My husband and I dined here yesterday for my birthday. We ordered the 3 course meal and my husband added the wine pairing to his meal. The place is run by a husband, wife and chef. The service was great, the husband and wife were very attentive. 

My husband ordered:
scallop appetizer
steak entree
apple crisp dessert

I ordered:
crab cake/ salad appetizer
chicken confit/ pasta entree
coffee semifreddo

We also received a complimentary chocolate and peanut butter dessert (which ended up being my favorite dessert out of the three) for my birthday treat.

Everything was delicious and reasonably priced for the quality and amount of food that we received. We also enjoyed their complimentary bread and homemade butter!
Highly recommended!
author: Lisa C.

description:
Found you!  A great neighborhood restaurant in the same vein as other great neighborhood gems in the city.  For the longest time, I could not  remember the name of this restaurant.  

I was on a trip in San Francisco with Jen H. and some of her friends.  The service of this place was extremely friendly and our waiter definitely made us felt at ease that we didn't even mind that he forgot one of our soups.  (I think the deliciousness of all of our other appetizers made up for it.)

There are some really great dishes that I would be willing to eat again and again. Some of the great dishes I had here was definitely the Heirloom Tomato Salad (great balance of sweet, salty, oily, and bitter).  The awesome foie gras they serve is also in a lobe and not a pate.  Great flavors all around.  The huge pork chop is extremely moist and definitely one of the highlights of the meal.  They also serve a really good spread of different butters.  My favorite one is the olive butter.  So good!

The chef came out to greet us afterward, which was a nice touch.
author: John H.

description: Classic French food and restaurant. My family loves to come to these sort of places that have tasting menus and lots of wine. The place is small with weird but quirky decor in that each table is divided with these big red curtains that reach from floor to ceiling. It gives a sense of privacy but it's different. My grandma got drunk off all the wine the owner poored her, he was really sweet and seems to have a great family and thing going for him at this restaurant.  The menu is not extensive, it's small and handmade but works well for them. It's more low key and quiet than other places of similar cuisine and price in the are. I would take a date here but something that's more serious, it's expensive and you have to be comfortable with the person since its intimate haha!
author: Kristin C.

description:
Can't say enough good things about the Richmond. My only hesitation in giving them five stars is that I'll somehow be making it harder on myself to get a reservation in the future.

John, the chef, came out and greeted our party, discussed the menu and was extremely attentive to our needs. 

The wine menu was extensive and the pairings were spot on. The food was delicious - and the service unparalleled. 

This place is a gem. I will definitely be back.
author: Steven B.

description: We had a wonderful pre-Valentines dinner and the owner felt like a personal friend before we left. The food was very good and it was just a nice warm solid experience. Glad to have found this little gem!
author: Natalie K.

description: the food, the people, the ambiance.  I'm hooked!   I really enjoyed the foie gras, I'm still dreaming of it.
author: Duane D.

description:
Great food.
Tasty wine.
Comfortable environment.
Friendly service.

I will visit again.
author: amber l.

description:
ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND!!!!  Walked in at 8:30 Saturday night, They were full but totally accommodated our party of 5. The food was fantastic and the owner was not only gracious but easy and friendly and a GREAT CHEF. Thank you all at
 The Richmond.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Gotta rep' The Richmond~!

Over two decades born and raised in the Inner Richmond district and just now recently discovered this diamond in the rough: better late than never! Anyways, it was just a casual Friday evening with my girlfriend, best friend, and an buddy visiting for the holidays, and we all winded up here in The Richmond. 

Amuse Bouche - Apple Cider with Holiday Spices 
Tis the season! It was a great way to excite my taste-buds. A very festive shot of warm apple cider with hints of cinnamon that really warmed the heart. 

Roasted Beet Salad - [http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/eNojl4S8pfBeXpZWOucwdg/l.jpg]
I'm not sure if I was suppose to eat this or admire it's beautiful placement because it looked like a work of art, and for a salad, there was nothing GREEN about it! However, the beet salad wasn't too much to rave about.. carrots, wafer, beets, moreover just more memorable by the presentation.

Sonoma Foie Gras - [http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/yVxUp323bijXbKT5ZAcfzg/l.jpg]
Okay, I'm not much of a foie gras fiend but OMG, this single-handily won me over. 
Another beautifully executed dish, a nice sear on the foie gras, and the crisp of the maple brioche perdu all together just melted in my mouth.. Make me an entree out of this because this is ridiculously delicious! 

Bacon-wrapped New York Steak - [http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/0vuGpI2H3iOpPcgNd6JLMw/l.jpg]
New York steak? wrapped in bacon!? simple yet genius! I love my beef bloody on the inside so I had it cooked medium rare and med-rare is what I got -- superb. It was a large steak, nearly 3/4th covered in crispy bacon, which laid atop of a bed of flavorful bok choy and diced taters. My steak was very juicy and still bloody when I took my first cut and the fusion of crispy pig and juicy cow all became one. 

Compliments to Chef John!

The Richmond is definitely a keeper in my book. It won't burn a hole in your pocket dining here (unless you love expensive wines) and it does have that quiet candlelight atmosphere, which is perfect for dates, but the restaurant itself isn't very big nor spacious within. For bigger groups, having someone get up just so another could go to the restroom was a little bothersome, but it wasn't that big of an issue for us. Our waiter, Rudy, was very knowledgeable and gave great recommendations for wines, while maintaining professional tact while dealing with us.. (we were quite belligerently intoxicated off the wine). All-in-all, a great night catching up with friends, eating beautifully delicious food, drinking good (and affordable) wine, and discovering one of Inner Richmond's hidden gems.
author: Albert L.

description: This is my second time having dinner here and again I enjoyed the 3 course tasting menu.  All of the food was well prepared and the portions were generous by SF standards.  I started with the crab cakes which were crunchy on the outside and soft and crabby on the inside - just the way that I like them.  This was followed by by perfectly cooked salmon and I finished up with the berries.  Service went from very attentive to occasionally hard to find but I think that can be expected in a small restaurant.  Don't expect highly unusual ingredients, this is simple good food, but well cooked.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Virginia T.

description: Very good food and service. The 3 course tasting menu was more like a prix-fixe since many tasting menus I've experienced have been on the miserly side both in food and wine pours. Owner makes sure wine pairings are up to snuff and generous and cares a lot about what you think of his restaurant. We'll be back.
author: Jim M.

description: I could have never expected such personalized service plus fantastic food, served with love. It's rare to get this type of attention from the chef, how the food is prepared, and the perfect wine, plus reasonable prices.  This is a unique, rare gem!
author: kari b.

description:
I found "The Richmond" by accident. It turns out to be a good experience. The decor is nothing fancy but very smart. I like the way they used curtain as a divider to make rooms or sections. I can tell you that the decor of the whole place won't cost $10000 to finish. 

The food, which surprisingly good. They cook the food in Chinese way and present it in a very elegant western way. (I can tell bcoz I'm a Chinese and I cook ALOT). I wouldn't say it's bad, which actually quite good and again, SMART. I can tell they manage the cost of food well under 20%. 

I especially like their bread and the 3 different kinda butter, which is very unique. The only reason I took away 1 star is the time they serve food. It took them over 15 mins just to serve us the bread. Thanx god we were not too hungry that night. Overall experience is nice. Me and my wife were having a great night.
author: Jason L.

description:
Truly a neighboorhood gem that serves great food at great prices! It has a fine dining feel without the pretention. The plates are artistically presented and the wine list is beyond reasonable. 

If you want to pamper yourself and not drop a load of dough, go for the burger and a glass of wine. You will be so happy you did. A must try if you haven't experienced it yet!
author: Stacy T.

description:
I was actually surprised to see a restaurant in my neighborhood to have this good of a Yelp rating, but I didn't think it was as stellar as everyone else made it to seem. Sure, I get the appeal of an upscale-yet-casual neighborhood eatery, but I thought the food was underwhelming not up-to-par with what they were trying to achieve.

Also, I was a little confused by the decor. It almost felt like half of the place was slowly being remodeled, as if it was in the middle of being filmed on Tabatha Takes Over. I actually wish Tabatha was giving it a makeover, because as my two-star review correctly states, "Meh. I've experienced better."
author: Jerome C.

description: Superb food and outstanding service. We have been here repeatedly and shared food among the diners. Everything I have ever tasted here was delicious! The Chef is congenial, open to suggestion, and so helpful. Intimate and romantic atmosphere. Planning a trip back in 2017. Among my top 5 favorite San Francisco restaurants.
author: Dorothy R.

description: After a 3 year absence, we drove an hour to The Richmond for our Anniversary.  We wished we could come more often, but when we do, we are always so thrilled with the service, food and atmosphere.  The service was great, the food was awesome not to mention the attentiveness by not just the server but the chef/owner.  He helped serve, pour wine, talked about the history and flavor of the wine not to mentioned prepared our fabulous meal.  Towards the end of our evening we over heard the other yelper who was 5 feet away from us complain to his friends.  "Well, it went from a 4 star to a 2 star". I almost thought we were at a different restaurant because we had a great experience.  To the guy that was there, next time try not to be rude and snarky as soon as your sat down and maybe you would of enjoyed the good food and not pick everything apart.
author: Lilly R.

description:
I have walked by here about 8-9 years ago (when I was in high school), curious about what this place was all about. At that time, I was young and inexperienced... didn't know much about Yelp or good food, but definitely thought this was a fancy place to go to. It had dim lighting with lots of small tables, making it look like a perfect place for a quiet evening in a neighborhood spot. Ahh... What a wonderful night that would have been. But somehow I had forgotten about this place until last week when I took my good friend here for her birthday. I can honestly say we had a wonderful time here, enjoying some wine and catching up. 

The service here was amazing. The two servers that were there were very attentive, friendly, and just plain wonderful. When I told the waitress that we were celebrating my friend's birthday, she brought her a little dessert with a candle on it, on the house! I could appreciate this place a lot for its service and ambience.

My friend and I each had a glass of wine although I cannot remember what they were anymore. I just know I got a glass of red wine and my friend had a white wine. No complaints about them. I think next time that I come, I'll definitely be choosing a bottle of wine from their extensive wine list and really just enjoy my wine. 

As for the food, I liked my linguini with clams. I couldn't finish it but it was good. I love my pasta :) My friend's salmon was pretty good but slightly dry. 

Regardless, this really is a great place for a date and so I will be taking my boyfriend here soon! Until next time, The Richmond......
author: Connie Y.

description: My husband and I found this gem of a place on a recent visit to San Francisco. The service is personalized and not rushed. Our meal was a three hour experience. The food was good, portions were a bit large. We chose the three course menu, with Wine pairings. The wine pours were very generous and the chef offered additional pours. A great little place, tucked in a non congested area of the city.
author: Lori M.

description: The foie gras adventures continues.  I would've never assumed this place was a restaurant, when I  pass by it in the car.  We made reservations and knew we all wanted to start with the foie gras.  The foie gras pairing was similar the the one I had at Chapaeu.   It was still pretty good and it wasn't over cooked .  And the size of the foie gras was pretty decent.  I do love the bread they have here. It comes with 3 different types of buttery spreads. regular butter with sea salt. olive and chive.  All the spreads were pretty good, but i think my favorite was the chive one.  However, I did not like my entree which was the Pork tenderlion with Swedish meatballs.  It was very tough and wasn't as tender as i hoped for. I wish i can give you four stars, but i really can't.
author: Belinda C.

description: Loved my experience at this small family owned restaurant. Ambiance was stellar (4.5), food was very good (4.5); service was excellent (5). The chef/owner is charming all around, and clearly puts a lot of TLC into his work: food and delighting his patrons. I had the three course menu with wine pairing. I would highly recommend for an intimate date night, or a nice dinner with a small group of friends.
author: Albany A.

description: The taste buds are satisfied, the restaurant environment is elegant, simple, convivial, and clean. There is always a plus when the staff are very friendly.
author: Queenie Z.

description: Excellent Food, Excellent Service.  Sarting from bread and all away up to desert - flawless. I think between 4 of us we ordered the whole menu after we tried their amuse bouche.
author: Avg G.

description:
4.5 stars for the food, 3.5 stars for the space.

My girlfriend and her family generously took me here for belated birthday dinner. Despite for years having scoured the Richmond for food of all kinds, I'd never heard of this place. How could a restaurant with 4.5 Yelp stars and an affordable tasting menu have flown under the radar?

Turns out it's for both good and not-so-good reasons that "The Richmond" isn't as hyped as other comparable restaurants.

The good is that the food is good. We ordered tasting menus all around, which consisted of the following courses:

1. Roasted beet and carrot salad with goat cheese pastry
2. Heirloom tomato salad with corn salsa
3. Seared scallop over something
4. Oxtail and oyster mushrooms over polenta
5. Some dessert I can't remember

The goat cheese pastry, heirloom tomatoes, and oxtail were especially good. Plus, each individual tasting menu item can be ordered individually a la carte, which is a nice option.

We also ordered a Shake N' Bake chicken entree which was deceptively great.

The bad is that, for a "nice" restaurant, the setting is kind of a mess. The restaurant is dark inside and small yet somehow not especially intimate. Our hostess was very kind but also dressed in jeans and a t-shirt, in contrast to the wait staff who wore black uniforms. Also, the restroom is under significant renovation, which I suppose isn't a flaw per se but it's more than a little jarring to walk behind the curtain, open the restroom door, and see concrete and no ceiling and a bunch of paper signs slapped onto the walls.

So, no plans to return anytime soon, but might be worth keeping an eye on any changes to the restaurant that might make it more of a fine dining destination.
author: Albert L.

description: We had a delicious meal at The Richmond. The chef was gracious with helping select the best wine to be paired with the steak. We each ordered the three course tasting meal, and all 6 dishes were fantastic. Our favorite was likely the rib eye and scallop appetizer, although the duck main course was a close second. We also enjoyed the desserts. No complaints. We'll be back.
author: Sarah B.

description:
My boyfriend found this little gem through Zagat. Rated 25, this place fits into its neighborhood in San Francisco. It looks like a hole-in-the-wall, didn't even realized we passed by until my boyfriend was already inside. 

First thing I saw when I walked in was a wine bar, the table complete with a collection of different wine crates and a beautiful and cozy wine cellar leading to the back.  However, I thought the atmosphere was kind of stiff.  It's definitely for the older crowd.

I ordered the scallops for appetizer.  I honestly don't like scallops that much, but the fact that they were braised in oxtail sounded especially pleasing so I had to try it. They were so delicious that I didn't want to give my boyfriend any...but did anyway so I could try his foie gras (also amazing!!!!!).  I would probably return and order those scallops again.  I ordered the Wild Pacific Cod with seafood chowder...a dish that was super delicious. The Richmond definitely had its sauce down!  I tried my friend's porkchop -- probably everyone's favorite for the night. My boyfriend had the seared hanger steak, which was pretty good, although everyone really did love the porkchop the most. Another friend of mine ordered the burger, and it was massive. It came with interesting sauces, including this one red vodka sauce (in place of ketchup perhaps?) and some home-cut french fries.  

Our waiter kind of reminded me of Justin Timberlake! He didn't pour our wine in proportion (there were 6 of us), but to make up for it he served the last two people 2 extra (and complimentary) wine glasses!  

I'd really like to give this place 4.5 stars, but I can't.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
My new favorite place in SF! The food was delicious, the owner was beyond courteous/welcoming, the wine was great and the prices were very reasonable-especially for such an amazing meal!

My boyfriend brought me here for dinner last night to celebrate my birthday. We had a bottle of the Sean Minor Cab - the owner described it as a "crowd pleaser" and it totally was! We had the short rib/seared scallop and the harvest salad as appetizers - both were fantastic. For our entrees, my boyfriend had the steak and I had the braised duck - so delicious. And for dessert we shared and apple crisp - also delicious. 

Aside from the food, the space is great. We had a large table for both of us and were not crowded in with other guests. I will definitely be back again and again. Cheers!
author: S. C.

description:
What a great experience! Took my GF here for anniversary dinner. I felt like I had a chef serving me dinner in the comfort of my own home. Nice, very calm, and relaxing.

Appetizer: The Bread (AMAZING), Some kind of salad with cranberries and walnuts (AMAZING)

My Entree: New York Strip steak over a Sausage Spinach concoction and potatoes w/ a house chosen red wine. (AMAZING. 2nd best steak I had in my life)

GFs Entree: Baked Chicken over Spinach and Potatoes w/ Chardonnay (She loved it!)

Dessert: Chocolate and peanut butter torte with vanilla ice cream (I almost fell asleep. So great!)

Family owned business, great people! Highly recommended. Great date spot!
author: Travis W.

description:
Official rating: 3.5 stars. 

I went here for my three year anniversary with my boyfriend. The service started off a little lacking; I had made reservations, but when we walked in, no one was there to greet us for at least five minutes. Don't be put off though--service quickly picked up after that however and was fantastic for the rest of the night.

Our waiter was extremely helpful with the wine selections (and they do have a very large wine list). He recommended a variety of wines and allowed us to taste many of them; he also brought two tasting glasses so that both of us could try the wines. The bread provided was also really yummy with the different dipping sauces. 

For the starter courses, we had the crab cakes and the whisky braised braised oxtail. The oxtail was the best dish of the night for me--it was tender and delicious. The crab cakes were decent, but nothing special. For the entrees, we ordered the hanger steak and the braised duck leg. Neither dish was especially out of this world; both dishes were technically cooked perfectly, but lacked creativity. The hanger steak was a perfect medium rare and the duck leg was fall-off-the bone, but both dishes seemed a bit uninspired--your standard meat dish with red wine sauce (something, that if I really wanted to, I could make at home). For dessert, we ordered the coffee semifreddo and the panna cotta. Again, both desserts were yummy, but nothing particularly special.

Overall, I thought that the food was good and cooked very well, but did not have much imagination. I'll admit, this is probably because I came in with VERY high expectations--4.5 stars out of 418 reviews led me to believe that this place was going to be mind blowing. The chef was clearly very well trained, but for the prices and taste, I didn't think that the food was original enough to warrant 4.5 stars. The restaurants itself is very small and intimate (great place to take a date), but the decor was a little bland and did not add much to the dining experience. While the service ended up being very helpful and the food cooked perfectly, I was disappointed that the food was not more imaginative. Generally speaking, the Richmond did not live up to my expectations of an upscale restaurant.
author: Angela T.

description:
The Richmond has the great service when you're wanting to reserve for a big party. My friends and I was organizing a graduation dinner a few months back and we called a few DAYS earlier. They were able to accommodate all 30 of us and create a prefixe for us! 

I was so astounded  by their readiness to create dinner and accommodate space in their dainty restaurant. They have great food in one of my favorite areas in sf. The place is so cozy and its great for dates. I highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Tessa A.

description:
BALLIN' ON A BUDGET...

Lately, I've been having luck finding neighborhood gems and The Richmond is one of them that Yelp has led me to. Tucked away in San Francisco's "New Chinatown" (Inner Richmond), The Richmond serves upscale New American fare at recession-friendly prices.  

Last Monday, 4.11.11, my friends and I (party of 4) came to The Richmond for dinner. We arrived for our 7 PM reservations and were promptly seated.

W I N E:
The Richmond's wine list focuses on small family wineries. Most of the wines by the glass were $6-$8 and bottles ranged from $14 - $750, so there's something for everyone. Corkage fee is $20/bottle. 

I started with a glass of the 2008 Ramsay Pinot Noir, North Coast ($7) which was rich and medium bodied with prominent strawberry notes and a touch of spice. 

F O O D:
(Sorry, no food pics since they didn't transfer onto my new phone.)

*AMUSE BOUCHE - Deviled Egg: THE PERFECT SMALL BITE! 

Rich, creamy and smooth with a slight tang to awaken your taste buds.

*SEARED FOIE GRAS w/ Apple Sauce & Pain Perdu ($15.95): DELISH!

The perfectly seared foie gras crowned a slice of crisp and soft pain perdu (French bread) with a surrounding dollop of apple sauce. Crisp around the edges, the foie gras gently crumbled and melted like butter in my mouth. Although buttery, the crisp and fluffy pain perdu was the perfect canvas for the foie gras since the subtle sweet tartness from the apple sauce helped to balance the rich flavors. 

*HANGER STEAK w/ a Pancetta, Potato & Brie filled Crepe ($19.95): DELECTABLE!

The hanger steak was grilled and sliced with a warm pink center. Hanger steak can be tough and chewy if not cooked properly, but the hanger steak at The Richmond was tender, moist and juicy. It was perfectly seasoned to bring out its natural beefy goodness. The crisp crepe was rich and savory; the brie added a milky richness, while the pancetta added a hint of porky saltiness. 

*PANNA COTTA w/ Lemon Curd & Streusel ($6.00): THE PERFECT SWEET ENDING!

Velvety smooth and thick, the panna cotta was rich and milky and the lemon curd added a burst of citrus punch and the streusel a sweet buttery crisp.

S E R V I C E:
Friendly and attentive. We were constantly being checked on so service was a bit on the "too" attentive side. Our water glasses were always filled like clockwork which we appreciated. 

What really surprised us is when the Chef came out to tell my friend that he had overcooked her steak a bit. He didn't want to serve the steak not properly cooked to her liking (she requested it rare), so he brought her a crab cake while he grilled her a new steak. We thought that was such a nice gesture and that the Chef really went beyond the call of duty. 

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R:
Upscale, yet casual with crisp white linen tables, mellow yellow walls and abstract artwork. It can get very quiet and tables are well spaced out so The Richmond is ideal for intimate dinners. 

P A R K I N G:
Easy street parking on the weekdays before 6 PM. Difficult street parking thereafter and on weekends. There are no nearby parking lots. 

If you're looking for a quaint date place with beautifully presented food that tastes as good as it looks and that won't break the bank, The Richmond IS the place!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
What a lovely neighborhood gem - refined yet unpretentious, comfortable, delicious with unbeatable value. 

I've heard of this place for a while now, and have always been curious to try because of the great reviews. So I was psyched when my fiance took me here for my birthday dinner.

The place didn't look much from the outside, but the wait staff made us feel welcome right as we stepped in. We were seated in a cozy little corner by the street-facing window, and made us feel very private. 

Their menu isn't huge, and changes periodically. There is a prix fixe 5-course tasting menu for $49.95 a person (excl. drinks) but we opted to go a la carte since our tummies have shrunken from our recent healthier diets (yay). 

Everything brought to our table was delicious! The bread & butter trio consisting of parsley chive butter, kalamatta olive butter, and sweet cream butter was a nice treat. I was good and indulged in only 2 pieces of bread; but I smothered the parsley chive butter ALL over my bread. So tasty! The palette cleanser of citrusy amuse bouche was interesting and refreshing. 

For appetizer we ordered the Roasted Beets & Cardamom Carrot Salad and Whisky Braised Oxtail with a Maine Diver Scallop. The beets salad was incredibly delicious, as was the braised oxtail and the scallop. The oxtail was full of flavor and of perfect texture, and the scallop was excellent and fresh. The creamy polenta upon which the oxtail and scallop sat tasted great with the oxtail sauce. Yummy!

We got the Braised duck leg, mushroom sauce and mashed potatoes and Hanger steak for our mains. My duck leg was tender and slide off the bones! The flavor was perfect, just enough duck and not overboard. I tried the hanger steak as well and it was meaty and satisfying. The portions were very generous and with all the apps, I only finished half of my entree! Finished off the memorable meal with a coffee semifreddo on the house.
