They were short a server and the place was crowded.  The food is some of the best I've had in SF.  It truly was a classy and not-overpriced meal.
author: Sean D.

description: 3rd visit.  The food is interesting and very good.  Always vegetarian choices which is nice.  The chef chose a wine for us and it was fabulous.  Service was slow.  However the chef is attentive.  He came out and moved us to a lager table.  The appetizer fried oysters were perfect and worth the most recent visit.
author: jesse e.

description: This is one of my  favorite local restaurants. The food's delicious and it's always a pleasant experience. I usually eat their seafood dish and my boyfriend will eat a red meat  - either of us is yet to be disappointed.. The butter spreads and bread are very tasty and I always have to stop myself from ruining my meal. The service is also very friendly. We often eat late and the owner-chef will come out and say hello. Overall it's a romantic little place tucked in an unusual part of the city.
author: cam b.

description: Recently dined here on a Saturday night. Great small neighborhood restaurant with a good wine list. Service has improved recently with the addition of a new waiter, the short  guy really took care of me and my partner. Small portions but tasty and fresh. A small space but  highly recommended.
author: peaceful mama x.

description: Love this place.  Service can be a bit European but the food is great.  I've been here as a couple, with a group of four and a group of 8 and our group actually agreed we all like it, which if you know my friends is a minor miracle.
author: Slappy F.

description: This is as good as it gets. What a gem tucked away in a neighborhood that feels like a secret. Almost like you should be talking about it in whispers because you don't want anyone else to know. We had an incredible 6-course tasting menu for under $50!!! Even the wine wine parings were a bargain and well chosen.
author: Roman S.

description: Impeccable meal, the service and food was to die for and the chef came over and talked to us several times. This place is an amazing find, there wasn't a bite I didn't rave about.
author: A G.

description: Picked this restaurant at the last minute after reading the new Zagat book which gave this place a very good rating.  We were not disappointe at all.  This was one of the best meals we have had in a long time.  It is small but cozy neighborhood restaurant.  Going on a weeknight we were able to get a table without a reservation.  We ordered our dinner and while we waited the waiter brought out a sampler of their potato leek soup which was delicious and on a somewhat cold evening hit the spot.  We were then brought what I would call a bread course in which they brought out homemade french bread that was outstanding with 3 different kinds of spreads (butter).  All were delicious.  Our actual starters were salads.  I have their harvest salad with mixed lettuce, gorgonzola, walnuts , dried cranberry--typical of what many restaurants serve but this was a cut above.  Dressed well, and plenty of ingredients put in the excellent category.  My wife had the heirloom tomato salad with corn salsa and avocado and it was also excellent. For our main course I had Pork Tenderloin with Mac and Cheese, and vegetables.  Very good portion, everything on the plate cooked to perfection--very successful entree.  My wife had a Chicken Scallopine with Chicken Ravioli--different type of dish but excellent.  She loved everything about it and of course we shared both dishes.  I thought the ravioli was exceptional.  For dessert we ordered their apple spice cake with homemade Vanilla Ice cream.  Because it was near closing time they also brought us an extra dessert (no charge) that they were featuring on their tasting menu.  Both desserts were excellent.  I should mention that every item was presented in a very artistic manner and added a lot to our enjoyment of the meal.  Last, the service was excellent.  Our waiter was very informative, attentive but not over board and brought everything in a timely manner.  We will definitely go back to this restaurant and highly recommend it to friends and family.
author: Wayne E.

description: As has been stated before, small space, sometimes a wait between being seated (even with a reservation) and service at table.  I had the potato leek soup which was good; smooth and creamy.  The heirloom tomato salad w/corn, roasted sunchoke and avocado was good also.  I had the burger and fries since I didn't want chicken and am allergic to fish.  It's a good burger but am hoping that the next menu change will have something else for me to try.  The chocolate tart w/choc crust and pulverized almond streusal was okay.  It came with a whipped cream flavored with cream of cacao and there is something about aeration like seltzer which at first to me made the cream taste like it had spoiled until the chef came out and said that was just the process to make it and it was supposed to taste and feel like that.  It's nice that the chef comes out and talks to the diners for a moment (how long he'll continue to do it is anybody's guess).  I'll try this place again sometime.
author: danielle b.

description: Had dinner here last night w/the fiance.  We didn't have reservations but they were able to accomadate us w/a very short 5 min wait.  Service here is nice and personable.  Although at times I had a had a little trouble understanding the host b/c of her accent.  Service was attentive although a bit slow but it didn't bother me much since it was nice ambiance, they checked enough, and i was in good company.  The owner also comes around and checks in w/each table.  We had the 'sloppy joe' flatbread and potato leek soup for appetizers.  They were both tasty and satisfying.  The portions are good size so we could've just shared the flatbread.  I had the pork tendorloin which was sooo tender but a tad on the salty side.  My fiance had the chicken was was very good.  It tasted very fresh w/clean flavors.  It must be free range organic chicken or something.  For dessert we shared the peach crumble.  I was sold on just the cinnamon ice cream itself but the peaches were fresh and it wasn't too sweet.  Prices were reasonable esp considering the portion sizes.
author: fattastesgood ..
